services.description:
Within the Borough we have many households who are looking for a new home, many specifically request and seek out landlords who are Landlord Charter Members because of the assurance of obtaining well managed, quality accommodation that membership implies.

The Landlord Charter is free to join and offers the following benefits.
- Time and cost savings 
- Provision of appropriate forms, including Tenancy Agreements.
- Assistance with Housing Benefit issues
- Information and advice on legislative issues 
- Support on maintenance and repair requirements
- Support for tenants to ensure sustained tenancies
- Access to Bond Guarantee Scheme
- Independent Dispute Resolution Assistance
- Advice and assistance with repossessions
- Assistance in securing suitable tenants 
- Advertise property on Choice Based Lettings website
- Possibility of having rent paid direct
services.keyFeature2: Improving standards in the Private Rented Sector
services.keyFeature5: Named officer to deal with enquiries
services.kiteMarks: Nominated for an LGC and LandlordZone awards in 2012

services.orgName: Redcar & Cleveland Money Tree Credit Union
services.description:
Not many people in the Redcar & Cleveland area are aware that there is a credit union on their doorstep.

A credit union is a profit sharing, financial co-operative, owned and controlled by its members and its aims are to encourage members to save regularly, provide loans to members at a low rate of interest after a qualifying period of saving for 13 consecutive weeks, and to help and support members with managing their finances.

We also run various schemes :- Co-op Electrical Goods, Quit and Save, Christmas savers, Baby Bump Bank & Junior savers.

The credit union can also help revive the local economy by keeping money within the community and also provides a focal point by bringing people together, to work alongside each other for their own benefit but also for that of the community.

Volunteers are NEEDED to help out at our collection points, full training is given freely. 

If you are interested or would like details of our collection points, please contact us on 01642 488227 or check out our website at www.rcmoneytreecu.co.uk.

services.description:
Support and Friendship for Families: Home-Start offers support, friendship and 
practical help to parents with young children in local communities. Home-Start 
offers a unique service by recruiting and training volunteers who are usually 
parents themselves to visit families at home who have at least one child under 
5 and offer them informal, friendly and confidential support. To help give 
children the best possible start in life, Home-Start supports parents as they 
grow in confidence, strengthen their relationship with their children and widen 
their links with the local community.

Would you like to be a volunteer? Do you remember what it was like when your 
children were little? Sleepless Nights, Teething, Tantrums or the Terrible 2's?

Many families need a friend. They are coping with impossible pressures due to a 
variety of reasons including divorce, loneliness, isolation and illness. 
Sometimes it helps just to have someone there to listen. Someone who 
understands just what it's like.

The work of a Home-Start volunteer can be challenging  but it is also 
rewarding, interesting and varied. Volunteers have "been there" and they can 
use their life experience to help others. Everyone has something to offer 
regardless of age, experience or background. Could you give 2-3 hours each week 
giving friendly support to a family until they are back on their feet?

Contact the Home-Start Co-ordinator Marjorie Hughes for details on how you can 
make a difference. Please contact 01642 501811 for further information. 
Home-Start value it's volunteers highly and provide full support and training 
as well as travel expenses.

services.description:
The Independent Living Centre is a resource and advice centre giving open 
access to a showroom of daily living equipment. It is designed to assist people 
who have difficulties with every day activities to increase or maintain their 
independence, improve their quality of life or to assist their supportive 
carers. 

The centre gives free and impartial expert advice on information and products. 
It enables people to compare and contrast a range of products, provides 
individual assessments (carried out by an Occupational Therapist), and informs 
people of their eligibility for provision of equipment locally and alternative 
sources including private purchase. Where the centre is unable to resolve a 
need presented by a service user they are referred onto a more appropriate 
agency/service.

Specialist exhibitions and demonstrations provided on regular monthly 
rotational basis. The centre provides access to an ongoing up to date computer 
database on Daily Living equipment, local and national disability organisations 
and groups that are available. It supports therapists in resolving service 
user's issues through improving access to specialised equipment and up to date 
information.

The centre acts as a training resource for carers and staff involved in the 
care of people with disabilities. The centre is also a resource for training 
organisations i.e. Colleges, Universities, and helps social services and 
voluntary agencies regarding equipment for people with disabilities.

CHILD Deaf Youth Project is a registered charity working for all D/deaf and hard of hearing children and young people in the Tees Valley. We provide new opportunities and experiences during out of school hours and holiday periods for young people aged 5 to 25 years. CHILD Deaf Youth Project activities reduce isolation, develop skills and self confidence and encourage independence.

Activities include: a senior youth club, for age 11 to 17 years on Wednesdays 6.30 to 8.30pm and a junior youth club for age 5 to 10 years on Thursdays 4.15 to 6.15pm. There are also summer schemes, residential breaks, an 18  25 group and a Befriender Service.

Services hours: The office is open from 9.30am to 5pm Monday to Thursday and activities take place out of school all year round. Cost: Currently costs vary from £3 upwards depending on the type of activity. Restrictions: The service is open to all D/deaf and hard of hearing children a nd young people, aged 5 to 25years, across the Tees Valley: including Middlesbrough, Redcar & Cleveland, Stockton, Darlington and Hartlepool.

services.tags: Drugs & Substance Misuse;Support Groups & Helplines;Information & Advice;Support Services
services.description:
Frank is a website and national telephone helpline offering advice, information 
and support to anyone concerned about drugs and solvent/volatile substance 
misuse, including drug misusers, their families, friends and carers.

Calls from landlines are free and won't show up on the phone bill. Calls from a 
mobile vary in cost depending on which network you're on and might show up on 
the bill.

You can talk to Frank in 120 languages - just call the same number and a 
translator will be there if necessary.

Redcar and Cleveland Library Service aims to provide a comprehensive, efficient 
and modern library service to all who live, work or study in the Borough by: 

Providing a Branch Library or Mobile Library Stop within easy reach of every 
household. Providing all library users with access to a good, well-balanced 
stock in all formats, including books, sound recordings and DVD's. Information 
on all subjects.
Public access to IT and the internet in all libraries subject to following fees 
- £1.00 for half an hour, £3.00 for 3 months, £10.00 per year. Please note that 
all junior members (up to the age of 18) can access the internet free of charge 
from library computers (subject to parental permission being granted to use the 
public pcs).
Ensuring all our libraries are safe, friendly, welcoming and fully accessible 
to all members of the public.
To provide a high quality, responsive service to the children and young people 
of Redcar and Cleveland, which actively seeks to meet their needs as 
individuals, whatever their age or stage of development by providing books, 
information and support from friendly, trained staff.

services.description:
Support, advice and information for teenagers who think they might be pregnant, 
pregnant teenagers and teenage parents.  

Sexual Health Services, contraception services, sex and relationship education.

C-Card Scheme is a confidential service for 13-19 year olds where they can 
access free condoms from various outlets (some youth centres, Connexions, 
Target). When registering for a C-Card the young person will receive guidance 
and advice around safe sex and condom use and must meet the Fraser Guidelines 
if under the age of 16. 

This service does not encourage young people to have sex, but does encourage 
delay and promotes safe sexual activity. Each young person who accesses the 
service receives education around these issues and the consequences of early 
and unprotected sex.

services.description:
Exercise to music in water. Non-swimmers and accompanied children welcome. Exercises can be adapted for individual needs and most levels of fitness or ability. Exclusive use of pool during aquafit sessions. All sessions led by qualified instructors. All equipment provided. Award winning community pool. Family-friendly and fully accessible. Ample free parking.

Other activities available: Swimming, including "Early Bird" sessions, swimming lessons for children and adults, life-saving and swimming clubs, women-only "ladies leisure" session, coffee mornings, special children's fun sessions during school holidays (please phone for details). Also:"Power Pilates" can be pre-booked) and Spinning sessions Tuesday 5.30-6.00 pm and Saturday 9.30-10.00 am (booking necessary).Pool can also be booked for children's parties.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: No booking required for Aquafit sessions, except for "Aquafit on Prescription" - please ask Pool Staff for advice on this.

services.tags: Counselling & Therapy;Families & Parenting;In School & Educational Support Services
services.description:
BEST work with children and young people and their families who may be 
experiencing difficulties either at school or within the home. 
The team consists of mentors and family workers offering this service to 
children of statutory school age to 14 years old. 
The team work together with schools and if required, other specialist agencies, 
to provide advice and support on parenting issues, health 
concerns and offer individual mentoring support to pupils within school. BEST 
offer group work within schools on issues relating to anti-bullying, 
self-esteem, anger management and friendships. BEST arrange regular review 
meetings in school inviting families and other relevant people to ensure 
information is shared and appropriate action is taken to support the family.
services.referralOnlyDetails: Referrals from School are discussed with the BEST Manager.

also we offer free internet access as we have free Wi-Fi and computers

advice, to job search help and from a venue for childrens parties, to slimming 
world groups, or there is the excellent range of adult classes from dress 
making to painting & decorating or from computer classes to patchwork & 
quilting.....On top of that, we have companies who rent space from us and 
provide services to the public such as Archers Law Solicitors, CCT computer 
repairman, Heritage Healthcare who provide domiciliary care services.

education and school sport, during the school week.

Residential outdoor education to primary schools particularly. The centre is available to the wider community during school holidays and weeks/weekends is available offering a variety of family, adult and children's holiday courses.

We also host corporate events and birthday parties. Facilities are also available for self catering, camping is an option and for day/evening visits. A range of outdoor activities are on offer from caving to climbing and so much more.

attraction to test riding skills of boys and girls of all ages. Offer three 
sizes of quad bikes to suit any age group and three different tracks for

to one basis and riders are fully supervised at all times whilst on track.  
Safety equipment is provided.  Party bookings also available.
Fishing also available at Lakeview - for adults and children.

Support services for women and children survivors of domestic or sexual abuse. 
Support groups and advocacy. One to one support. Rape and sexual abuse 
counselling. Children's outreach service 4-18 years. Domestic violence 
counselling. Children's counselling. Women's outreach service - supporting 
women in communities - may still be in the relationship. Independent Domestic 
Violence Advisors (IDVA) get referrals from MARAC board - for high risk women 
(referred from police etc). Sexual Violence helpline: 01642 835079 - counsellor 
available Mon 4.30 - 7 pm; Weds 4.30 - 7 pm.

services.description:
Family Days Out

Conferences and Meeting Venue
Work Experience and Volunteering

At Nature's World we aim to provide you with more than just a visit to the UK's 
pioneering eco-experience, our plan is to provide you with information, 
education, ideas and an inspiration for looking after the environment. By using 
sustainable practices, such as renewable energy and recycling, we have created 
a 25-acre peaceful rural haven on the edge of urban Middlesbrough. Nature's 
World has evolved into a thriving visitor attraction, training centre and 
education facility for the whole of the local and wider community including 
schools, the unemployed and disabled. With on-site tearooms serving both hot 
and cold food & drink, ample free car parking and so much to see and do why not 
come and experience the beauty of Nature's World for yourself.

services.description: The Families' Information Service provides information, advice and guidance for parents, carers, practitioners and children on the wide range of services and activities/events available for children and young people aged 0-20 years old. We can help you: Find local childcare We offer independent information and advice about the childcare provision throughout Redcar and Cleveland, including registered day nurseries, childminders, playgroups, creches, out of school clubs, and unregistered breakfast clubs, parent and toddler groups, holiday playschemes and holiday activities. services.tags: Arts & Culture;Places to Visit;Venues for Hire
services.description:
Kirkleatham Museum is the local history museum for the Borough of Redcar and 
Cleveland.  The main purpose of the Museum is to illustrate how both ordinary 
and distinguished people have lived in the locality in the past.  The Museums 
collections are drawn mainly from the communities throughout the region.

Educational and Group Visits -  we provide a changing range of temporary 
exhibitions throughout the year, as well as associated special activities, 
events, crafts and guided walks.  Many of these are suitable for school and 
group visits or for out of school groups, playschemes and holiday activities.

Family Activities - During school holidays Kirkleatham hold various events for 
school children.  Please keep posted for the up and coming events for the next 
half term.  All materials are provided.  Craft sessions are 'drop in' and run 
between 10am -12 Noon and 1pm - 4pm.  Most activities take about half an hour 
to complete.  Children must be accompanied by an adult.

Gardens - including children's play area and picnic area.

Refreshments - Lillies' Cafe offers a selection of meals in pleasant indoor or 
outdoor surroundings.

School groups and party visits - guided tours and special facilities bookable 
in advance.

Inside museum is reception desk and shop sales counter selling souvenirs, 
books, postcards and gifts.  Our friendly and helpful staff will be pleased to 
help you get around the displays.  Please ask if you would like some help. 
Museum has three floors and is completely accessible for wheelchair users.  
Guide dogs and hearing dogs are welcome in the museum and in the cafe.

Also on site grounds are Kirkleatham Owl Centre - telephone 01642 480512 and 
Sir James Knott Lifeboat.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: For School and Group bookings please contact Liz Vine, Education Officer, at the Museum.
services.dropInDetails: Holiday Craft Activities - places on a first come first served basis.  Other activities to do around the museum and grounds while waiting for a place. Costs from 50p- £3.50

disabilities. We aim to ensure that both the child and their parents have 
access to early years childcare and education. We can help by:

Providing high quality support to individual children with special educational 
needs or disabilities.
Giving advice to registered settings on suitable play equipment.
Supporting children who attend the Cleveland Unit in Middlesbrough.
Providing advice and support with curriculum activities to promote inclusive 
practice.
Give advice on routines and procedures to help all children to have an 
inclusive early education.
Support the smooth transition into school.

services.tags: In School & Educational Support Services;Disability Services
services.description:
The SEN Service is situated in Children's Services, Education Department, 
Council Offices in Redcar. The main work of the Service is to co-ordinate 
Statutory Assessment procedures, to arrange for appropriate special educational 
provision to be put in place for children with Statements of Special 
Educational Needs and to keep them under review. Staff also liaise with 
schools, parents / carers and other agencies in the issuing of documentation. 

Service staff can give you advice about SEN arrangements and Statutory 
Assessment procedures. If your child is undergoing Statutory Assessment they 
will be able to keep you informed about the progress of the assessment. If your 
child has a Statement of Special Educational Needs the SEN Link Officers are 
your main point of contact if you have any questions about your child's Special 
Educational Needs. SEN Link Officers support an identified cluster of schools 
in the assessment procedure, offering advice to schools on their legislative 
responsibilities as laid out in the Code of Practice. They will also liaise 
with parents/carers on aspects of their childs education. Link Officers will 
also represent the Local Authority at statutory annual, interim, transition and 
multi-agency reviews as required.

services.tags: Finding a Job;Debt & Money Advice;Benefits & Welfare Rights
services.description:
Jobcentre Plus is a government agency supporting people of working age from 
welfare into work, and helping employers to fill their vacancies. We are part 
of the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP ) and play a major role in 
supporting the Department's aim to 'promote opportunity and  independence for 
all through modern, customer-focused services'.

Our key objectives are to:

Increase the effective supply of labour by promoting work as the best form of 
welfare and helping unemployed and economically inactive people move into 
employment. Work towards parity of outcomes for ethnic minority customers. Pay 
customers the correct benefit at the right time and protect the benefit system 
from fraud, error and abuse. Provide high-quality and demand-led services to 
employers, which help fill job vacancies quickly and effectively with 
well-prepared and motivated employees. Help people facing the greatest barriers 
to employment to compete effectively in the labour market and move into and 
remain in work. Improve continuously the quality, accessibility and delivery of 
services to all customers. Ensure that people receiving working age benefits 
fulfil their responsibilities while providing appropriate help and support for 
those without work. Increase Jobcentre Plus overall productivity, efficiency 
and effectiveness.
services.contactTel: Contact:  national Jobcentre Plus 0845 604 3719 (who will then connect you to Guisborough Jobcentre)
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: Majority of services are by appointment only - please ring to arrange

services.description:
Redcar & Cleveland College offers full and part-time courses at all levels, from entry-level to HNCs and degree qualifications. The College also offers a wide range of business training courses, including specific tailored packages, short-update courses and access to funding support where applicable. Redcar & Cleveland College has a fantastic range of courses of offer in the following areas: -Art & Design -The Built Environment -Business Administration & Retail -Childcare -Computing & IT -Counselling -Engineering & Science -Hair, Beauty & Holistics -Health & Social Care -Public Services -Sports & Fitness -Teacher Education & Learner Support -Travel & Tourism The College offers a FREE college coach link on routes throughout the area for full-time students under 19 years old. Please see the College's website for details. The college moved to a £28 million purpose-built campus in September 2008, which provides a state-of-the-art learning environment for students. It offers the latest audio visual, computer and support systems, equipment and tools for students to enjoy an outstanding learning experience. The college opened its multi-million pound Higher Education Centre in September 2010, to deliver the state-of-the-art learning facility for students studying Higher Education courses. The exciting new centre now makes it much easier for people in Redcar and East Cleveland to study degree courses by providing a local facility. The realistic and professional working environments offered by the college are set to a very high standard. Together, with high quality teaching and learning from an energetic team of committed and highly experienced staff, the college can provide one of the very best learning experiences you could ever wish to have. The colleges recent and full Ofsted inspection has officially graded the college as A Good College. The Ofsted inspectors reported that the new college building and its resources are deemed to be outstanding.

College Website: www.cleveland.ac.uk College Facebook: www.facebook.com/redcarcollege

We have been working since 1986 to promote high quality affordable childcare 
for all. We know how important it is to make the right decisions for your child 
and we hope this website will help you find out more about childcare. 

Over 450,000 people a year benefit from Daycare Trusts Information Services, 
through our web information and telephone and email helpline service. Our 
Information Line provides comprehensive information about childcare to callers; 
from parents trying to find out about their childcare options and the help they 
can get to pay for childcare, to employers seeking information about setting up 
a childcare scheme for their employees. To find out more about childcare: 

Call our Information Line on 0845 872 6260

Computershare Childcare Services (formerly known as Busy Bees) are an employee 
benefit that offer a tax break for working parents. A Childcare Voucher Scheme 
must be administered by an employer. Childcare Vouchers can be used to pay for 
all types of registered child care.
Childcare Vouchers are non-taxable and exempt from National Insurance 
contributions (NICs) for employees. Childcare Vouchers also offer National 
Insurance contributions savings for employers. Childcare Vouchers are a 
government work-life balance scheme, supported by HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC). 
Childcare Vouchers have become a recognised payment method for child care in 
the UK. All eligible working parents, with children aged under 16 are able to 
benefit from Childcare Vouchers, provided their employer offers the Childcare 
Voucher scheme. Childcare Vouchers benefit both basic and higher rate 
tax-payers.
Computershare Childcare Services has been involved within the Childcare Voucher 
sector for over 10 years and currently supplies Childcare Vouchers to more UK 
organisations than any other provider. Computershare Childcare Services are the 
UK's largest dedicated Childcare Voucher provider. We have a team of over 250 
staff dedicated to the administration, management and development of Childcare 
Vouchers. Computershare Childcare Services is a Computershare company.

services.tags: Support Groups & Helplines;Information & Advice;Black & Minority Ethnic
services.description:
The Equality and Human Rights Commission is a non-departmental public body 
which was established by the Equality Act 2006. It replaces the Equal 
Opportunities Commission, Disability Rights Commission and Commission for 
Racial Equality. The Commission also operates a Helpline which provides 
information and guidance on discrimination across the nine protected grounds - 
age, disability, gender, race, religion and belief, pregnancy and maternity, 
marriage and civil partnership, sexual orientation and gender reassignment, The 
Commission can also provide guidance on human rights.

Sexwise is a helpline that offers free, confidential advice on sex, 
relationships and contraception or you can visit websites.  For contact details 
in your local area please visit website 
http://www.nhs.uk/Livewell/Sexandyoungpeople/Pages/Sex-and-young-people-hub.aspx

services.description:
Leisure Centre offering:

Sports Hall
Energy Club Fitness Gym and Energy Group Fitness 
Redcar Bowl Entertainment Facility

Surf coaching and/or instruction for groups or one to one tuition.  All 
equipment is provided together with fully qualified instructors.

At Saltburn Surf School not only do we coach in the physical elements of the 
sport and have had a great success rate in the past, but we also teach you the 
fundamentals.  We pride ourselves in the fact that when you complete a lesson 
you will have the knowledge of how and why waves occur and will have some 
understanding of the natural processes of weather and sea.  Saltburn Surf 
School still remains the only BSA* approved school in the east coast region.

In this ever busy world that we live and work in, surfing can be 'escapism'. 
Whether you treat yourself to a lesson or give a lesson as a  gift to someone 
else, from our experience it will be money well spent.  So have a lesson by 
yourself or with a group and look forward to enjoying the fun and exhileration 
of riding your very own wave.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: Contact for appointment/lesson booking - on day of lesson it will be confirmed depending on wather and sea conditions.

services.tags: Benefits & Welfare Rights;Health Care Services;Families & Parenting
services.description:
Give your kids the best start in life... families on certain benefits can get 
free milk, fruit and vegetables.

You qualify for Healthy Start if youre at least 10 weeks pregnant or have a 
child under four years old and you or your family get:
Income Support, or Income-based Jobseekers Allowance, or Income-related 
Employment and Support Allowance, or Child Tax Credit (but not Working Tax 
Credit unless your family is receiving Working Tax Credit run-on only*) and has 
an annual family income of £16,190 or less (2011/12).

You also qualify if you are under 18 and pregnant, even if you dont get any of 
the above benefits or tax credits.
*Working Tax Credit run-on is the Working Tax Credit you receive in the 4 weeks 
immediately after you have stopped working for 16 hours or more per week.

For more information or to make an application for the Healthy Start Vouchers 
visit website or telephone 0845 607 6823.

Bounty is your pregnancy and parenting club there for you from bump to baby and 
beyond.  It was created to bring mums-to-be and new mums trusted advice on 
pregnancy and being a parent, not to mention the famous Bounty packs to help 
care for the whole family.  Bounty.com is packed with news and features about 
pregnancy and parenthood plus you can go shopping get special offers from 
retail, finance and travel partners.

services.description:

a practitioner listening to a child / young person or parent to find out what 
help the child may need and then together look at the ways to support them 
which may include another service becoming involved.

services.description:
We at Little Waves Day care aim to offer high quality care and education for 
young children aged 6 weeks - 5 years.

The Early Years Foundation Stage framework is practiced within the setting to 
enable the children to meet the 'Every Child Matters' learning outcomes.  This 
framework is delivered using fully qualified staff who have full CRB checks.

We have a wide range of facilities available for children to learn and explore 
through a wide range of materials and equipment.

We have outside play areas which are very secure.  We have 3 different areas 
for each age group, all of which are very bright and colourful.  There is also 
small garden areas available for children to plant from seed.

We are situated next to a public Sure Start Park, which children can visit with 
Staff, whilst at Nursery. 

Childcare offered is full time, lunchtime and wraparound and pick up from the 
following schools:-

Montessori equipment in designated areas - practical life (to promote fine 
motor skills, early maths and language skills); sensorial activities (to refine 
senses, encourage mathematical skills & thinking, lay foundations for the 
future learning in maths and language and sciences.  Science activities; maths 
equipment, langauage activities.  We also have daily French sessions during the 
morning session.  The montessori approach encourages children to become 
independent, and to learn by doing.  They have the freedom to choose their own 
activities and are given the time to work uninterupted until they choose to 
finish, in a calm and caring environment.

services.description:
RCVDA provides a wide range of support and services to groups, helping those 
who are starting up as well as groups that are well established. We deliver a 
wide range of services and support including:

Funding advice, help to set up a group, support for committee members and 
advice on running a group.  We also support individuals who wish to volunteer 
by signposting them to relevant opportunities.

We provide children aged 18month-8 years with opportunities to learn through 
play in a stimulating environment with trained friendly staff. Open all year 
round and you may be entitled to reduced fees if you are in receipt of certain 
benefit.  Two fantastic outdoors areas with supervised free flow play.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: Please call for details

services.description:
Redcar and Cleveland Library Service aims to provide a comprehensive, efficient 
and modern library service to all who live, work or study in the Borough by:

Providing a Branch Library or Mobile Library Stop within easy reach of every 
household.

Providing all library users with access to good, well-balanced stock in all 
formats, including books, sound recordings and DVD's. Information on all 
subjects.

Public access to IT and the internet in all libraries £1.00 for half an hour, 
£3.00 for 3 months, £10.00 for year. Please note that all junior members (up to 
the age of 18) can access the internet free of charge from library computers 
(subject to parental permission being granted to use the public pcs).

Ensuring all our libraries are safe friendly, welcoming and full accessible to 
all members of the public.

To provide a high quality, responsive service to the children and young people 
of Redcar and Cleveland, which actively seeks to meet their needs as 
individuals, whatever their age or stage of development by providing books, 
information and support from friendly, trained staff.
services.dropInDetails:
Drop in during opening times
Telephone for more information on events taking place.

services.serviceName: Redcar Community College - A Specialist Visual and Performing Arts Centre
services.description:
Secondary education provision for 11-16 year olds.  

The College is a full service extended school.  We provide a range of services 
and activities and events e.g., Cookery Courses, Parent Survival Courses, Study 
Support, Inter Agency Working via our SMART panel, Homework Club, Community Art 
classes, Fitness, Dance, Primary University and Community Health days and 
drop-ins.  Wide variety of school facilities available for hire - Sports Hall, 
School Gym, Drama studios, Compass Centre and many more.

Please see school website for further information on learning and leisure 
courses, bookings, activities or extended services contact Jean Brook on 01642 
289211 ext 1112 or email: office@redcarcc.com

Middlesbrough Theatre hosts a diverse range of professional and non-professional performing arts to the people of Middlesbrough, the Tees Valley and surrounding districts in friendly and welcoming surroundings.

For access to the latest brochure of What's On at Middlesbrough Theatre, please use the theatre website address.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: All performances are bookable in advance by calling the Middlesbrough Theatre Box Office on 01642 815181 or the Town Hall Box Office on 01642 729729.

services.description:
Veronica offers care before and after school, evenings, part time, weekends, 
term time, overnight, emergency short term cover

Can pick up/collect from Normanby Primary School

Donna offers care all year, full time, short term, early mornings, before and 
after school, school holidays and holiday cover and emergency cover.  

She offers a wide range and facilities and activities and can pick up/drop off 
from South Bank Primary, St Margaret Clitherow's RC Primary and Teesville 
Infant School.

Is your child full of energy and loves the outdoors, enjoys walking through the 
forest looking for badger holes etc. or enjoys playing in the park or picnics 
on the beach. We also attend all the local play groups and libraries. I find it 
is very important for children to interact with other children, it helps them 
in so many different ways, it helps them to develop into confident, friendly, 
caring, sharing children. I am also happy to help with toilet training as I 
have 3 children myself and successfully trained all 3 at the age of 18 months 
old, so I do consider myself as a good teacher. We all enjoy learning numbers, 
colours etc. all as part of a group and we are all coming on brilliant. I offer 
a reward chart for the best behaved child at the end of the week, he/she gets 
to chose where we are going on our treat, whether it be the wacky warehouse, 
fun house, beach, park, forest, farm, etc. Please feel free to give me a ring 
for a chat and ask about availability.

Susan offers care all year, before and after school, part time, full time, 
evening cover, emergency cover, short term cover

Can pick up/drop off from St Margaret Clitherow's RC Primary School and South 
Bank Primary.

I have been a registered childminder since May 2003.  I live within easy 
walking distance of local amenities such as a play park, leisure centre, 
library, primary schools and shops.  I have a Cache Level 3 Diploma in Home 
based Childcare, a Cache Level 3 in Childcare, Learning and Development and I 
am a member of the National Childminding Association.  I have a warm and caring 
atmosphere within my home in which the children and their families feel 
welcome.  My learning environment is organised appropriately to meet all 
children's needs, and all toys are age appropriate.  The children enjoy regular 
outings to play groups, parks, soft play areas and museums.  They are offered a 
balanced nutritious lunch, and snacks and drinks are available throughout the 
day.  I have a large enclosed rear garden with a variety of outdoor toys.

Jenny offers care after school, before school, emergency cover, evening cover, 
short term cover and school holidays

Can pick up/drop off from St Bede's RC Primary and Westgarth Primary School

Facilities include: Arts and crafts, baking, bikes, board games, books, 
building blocks, dolls, dressing up, garage and vehicles, jigsaws, out-door 
play, outings, playstation, puzzles and games, scooters, sleeping area, songs 
and rhymes, tv/video, visits to parent and toddler groups  

I will be taking the children on outings to parks, playgroups, the beach and 
other things that may be happening in my area.

Karen offers care before and after school, evenings,  in term time and holidays

Can pick up /drop off from Normanby Primary School

including two swimming pools, sports hall, Energy Club fitness gym and dance 
studio, indoor bowls, floodlit outdoor Multi Use Games Area and squash courts, 
and services including exercise on prescription, full day care during all major 
school holidays, remedial therapy, childcare, swimming lessons, personal 
training, cyber coach interactive fitness classes.

services.description:
The Community Centre is a locally managed and run centre.  The size and layout 
of the hall make it an ideal choice for Private and Business funtions.
 The Community Centre is now the UK online centre for Guisborough and 
surrounding area. This means that you can now learn how to use the internet for 
free. Dance and Yoga classes are sometimes held in the hall please telephone 
for more information

It has a large and small hall, ramped access, wheelchair accessible toilet, 
tables and chairs, kitchen for making drinks and snacks and roadside parking.

The hall is available for hire for meetings, training, parties, dances, sport 
classes, functions, social events, fairs and sales.

If you would like to book a hall for any Private or Business function the 
voluntary management committee of Charltons Community Centre would like to 
invite you to consider their service.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: Telephone to discuss availability

services.description:
Gillian offers care after school, before school, emergency cover, holiday 
cover, short term cover and Full Time cover

Can pick up/drop off from Westgarth Primary School and St Bede's RC Voluntary 
Aided Primary School

Facilities include arts and crafts, baby toys, baking, bikes, board games, 
books, building blocks, cars, construction, cooking, dolls, dressing up, garage 
and vehicles, jigsaws, out door play, pets, play house, puzzles and games, 
scooters, sleeping area, songs and rhymes, tv/video, visits to parent and 
toddler groups, water play

The Guisborough Bridge Association aims to provide life and support in the  
heart of the community.  It was set up as a community project by Churches 
together in Guisborough and is an independent charity.

Activities include:

 Guiz  Kidz - The aim of Guiz Kidz is to provide a place and style of church 
service  for children aged 5-11 on a Sunday morning. Guiz Kidz is for all 
children in  Guisborough, whether they go to church or not.

Summer holiday club - the last 3 years we have run summer holiday clubs 
[pirate, spy and egyptian themes so far] for primary age children with games, 
crafts, stories and music.

Soup and a Roll - Teams of volunteers sell soup, rolls, teas and coffees -  
offering a nutritious and inexpensive lunch.  This activity is extremely 
popular and a valuable fund raiser.

Chatroom and Bridge2Youth - Chatroom is a Wednesday lunchtime meeting at the 
Laurence Jackson youth centre that runs during term-time. And on a Friday night 
we have Bridge2Youth from 7.30 to 9.15pm. Both these groups are for young 
people to come along and have fun and learn about issues relevant to them ... 
We also plan events like youth weekends, coffee mornings and holiday clubs for 
11-16 year olds.

Coffee Mornings from 10-12 at Sunnyfield House every Tuesday - an opportunity 
to call in for home baking, welcoming atmosphere, regular book stall and a chat.

Christmas Day Meal - we would hate to see anyone in Guisborough alone at so we 
have a this festive time and we provide a meal at the Methodist Church on 
Christmas Day.
 
Parenting support - practical help and befriending for new mums and parenting 
courses to gain insight in a supportive environment

Homeless - to put people in touch with organisations that can offer advice and 
support on various aspects of homelessness.

Other activities include : listening service, prayer breakfast, and support for 
the Half Century Club open to anyone over 50.

For more information on the above activities please visit website or telephone 
for details.

Marske Children's Centre offers opportunities for children aged 0-5 years old 
and their families.

The range of activities we offer cover the following themes:

* Learn Together
* Health drop-ins
* Infant Massage
* Training & Employment opportunities
* Childminder Group
* Advice and Information

Venue also available for hire - holds max 20 persons. Facilities available are 
kitchen, PC, overhead projector, tables/chairs, internet connection. 

For more information please telephone the individual Children's Centre.  
Alternatively, you can visit the sure start website for a full list of all 
activities.

services.description:
I worked with children in a day nursery from leaving school.  Then left and had 
3 children but worked part time in an infant, junior and senior schools.  I 
have 5 grandchildren which I always have around, of these 2 live with me both

company of other children.  We have a front garden fenced in and a high fenced 
back.  We have lots of indoor and outdoor toys as our home is any childs home.

I offer care weekdays, mornings, afternoons, before school, after school, all 
year, emergency and short term cover and School Holidays.

Kay offers care emergency, short term cover, after shool, before school, day

Facilities include baby toys, quiet area, songs, rhymes, books, art & crafts,

Kay has a Diploma in Home Based Childcare.  She provides a professional quality

For more information and vacancies please contact Families' Information

Amanda offers care weekdays, day time, before and after school, early mornings,

I take the children on regular outings no matter what the weather we do

services.description:
Lynn offers care emergency, short term cover, after school, before school, 
early mornings, evenings, full time, holiday cover and school holidays.

Pickup/Drop off from Belmont Primary School, Guisborough.

Facilities include Arts and Crafts, Baby Toys, Ball Pool, Bikes, Board Games, 
Books, Bouncy Castle, Building Blocks, Computer, Construction, Cooking, Dolls, 
Dressing Up, Home Corner, Jigsaws, Outdoor Play, Outings, Pets, Play House, 
Playstation, Puzzles and Games, Sandpit, Scooters, Sleeping Area, Songs and 
Rhymes, Toddler Group Visits, Toy Library, Toys and Games, TV/Video, Water.

Accepts all Childcare Vouchers.  I offer a caring home based facility between 
the hours of 6.30am - 6.30 pm Monday to Friday and am always willing to go that 
extra mile.  I have an NVQ 3 in Childcare, First Aid, Food Hygiene and Child 
Protection qualifications.  Lynn is also a registered Aiming High Childminder 
able to offer childcare for disabled and additional needs children.

Tracy's childminding service is known as TWINKLES CHILDMINDING - A safe and 
happy place for your little stars.

My name is Tracy, I am married, have two children and a tank full of tropical 
fish.  I hold Paediatric First Aid and Food Hygiene Certificates, have 
completed Safeguarding Children Training and follow the EYFS Framework.  
My main priority is your child's happiness and I offer a childminding service 
that will meet the individual needs of your child.  My home is a safe and happy 
place where your child can enjoy a wide variety of stimulating and fun 
activities.  I have a wide variety of age appropriate quality toys, your child 
will have the opportunity to do lots of messy painting and gluing and I have a 
well stocked library  for story times.  We also enjoy a lot of singing, signing 
and dancing.  My garden is safe and secure with plenty of play equipment, sand, 
water fun and grass to keep children happy.
I also ensure that your child will experience social interaction through local 
toddler groups and have memorable days out visiting local parks, museums, farms 
and the seaside, while you can rest assured of their safety at all times.
I believe every child is unique and deserves to be treated as an individual, 
therefore I value your guidance on what is best for your child and I endeavour 
to share the events of your child's day with you through regular updates and 
journals.  I supply healthy snacks and drinks and a healthy varied lunch menu.  
I offer term time only full time care, emergency care, before and after school 
care and can pick up/drop off at St Benedict's RC Primary school.  I look 
forward to welcoming your child into my home.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: Telephone the Families' Information Service for more information

services.description:
Julie offers care all year, before and after school, part time, emergency, 
short term cover, evenings, full time and holiday cover.

Pickup/Drop off from Teesville Infant School and Ravensworth Junior School

At my last inspection (July 2009) OfSted reported" The excellent range of 
balanced and varied activities that are planned and available to children fully 
promotes their all-round learning and enjoyment to a high degree".

I promote a happy environment where children can have fun whilst they are 
playing and learning.  I have been childminding since May 2003.  I am a member 
of the National Childminding Association (NCMA) and also Redcar & Cleveland 
Childminding Network, where I attend regular training and meetings to keep me 
up to date with current legislation.  Both my husband and I hold current 
Paediatric First Aid Certificates and I also hold an NVQ Level 3 Certificate in 
Early Years & Education.

Facilities include enclosed rear garden, arts and crafts, baking, board games, 
building blocks, dressing up, dolls, jigsaws, sand & water, songs and rhymes, 
TV/DVD, baby toys, large outside play area, separate play room designed for 
childminding, bikes, scooters, play house, slide, visit to parks, Surestart 
Centres, soft play and libraries.

For more information please contact the Families' Information Service.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: Telephone the Families' Information Service for more information

services.description:
Jenny offers care all year (but prefers term time only), part time and short 
term cover, before and after school.  She offers a wide range of facilities.

I am a 35 year old Mum of 2 boys (aged 4 and 6). We live in a spacious house 
with a large garden in Redcar East.  I provide a caring and stimulating 
environment.  I plan to meet each individual child's needs through; indoor and 
outdoor play, adult led activities and daily outings.  I provide healthy 
balanced meals and snacks.  I am fun, enthusiastic, well organised and 
practical.  I was graded "Good with some outstanding outcomes" by OfSted.  I 
have my own car and am able to pick up / drop off at John E Batty and Ings Farm 
Primary schools.

I am an OfSted registered childminder.  I live in Guisborough with my husband 
and I joined the Redcar & Cleveland Childminder Network when it first started 
in Feb 2003.  I am also a member of the National Childminder Association.  I 
was inspected by OfSted in June 2009 and received "Outstanding" in all areas.  
To view my full report, please go to the OfSted website.

I offer a wide selection of activities including arts and crafts, baby toys, 
building blocks, dressing up, jigsaws, books, construction, baking, small world 
toys, bikes, scooters, bats, balls etc  I take the children to Mother and 
Toddler sessions, visit to parks and soft play centres etc. 

I have a 7 seater car for transporting the children in; I have business cover

services.serviceName: EOTAS - Education Other Than At School
services.description:
The E.O.T.A.S. Service offers help to children and young people who are out of 
school for a number of reasons: anxious, phobic, sick, pregnant, excluded or at 
risk of exclusion.

Primary children in the East Cleveland and Guisborough areas whose behaviour in 
school is of major concern, are offered part-time admission to a Support Centre 
in Skelton and are supported back into their own school.

Secondary pupils who are out of school attend the Eston Centre. Those who are 
able to will be supported in their return to mainstream school. Those who are 
unable to return to school will be offered an alternative education in Key 
Stage 4 involving basic skills education, work experience, work placement and 
vocational college courses.

Children who are sick or convalescing or waiting placement elsewhere will be 
given at least 5 hours a week of home tuition.

Contact EOTAS:
Tel: (01642) 440225

and also have the opportunity to  participate in group and project work.

services.description:
Single parent? Looking for single parent holidays? Or simply a chat online with 
other lone parents to share a problem or fill an empty evening whilst the kids 
sleep?

Divorced, bereaved or simply alone, life in a one parent family can be 
challengingto say the least.  Whether you're a single mum or single dad, our 
site offers you comprehensive single parent support to help you through the 
early days. Struggling to fill an empty weekend? Check out our AwayDays for 
regular single parent trips, get-togethers and holidays.  Make new friends and 
share experiences on our online forum, and for anyone brave enough to try it 
all again, we've partnered with KNO, a fantastic single parent dating site, 
with many members looking for love. Ok, so we don't do your ironing for you or 
pick the kids up from school, but we think we've covered just about everything 
else!

services.description:
MIMA is one of the UK's leading art galleries, based in Middlesbrough. The 
gallery exhibits, commissions and collects world-class modern and contemporary 
art and craft from 1900 to the present, and is a centre of excellence for 
drawing, contemporary jewellery and ceramics.

MIMA hosts a changing programme of exhibitions, featuring work by 
internationally acclaimed artists. The gallery brings together the town's art 
collections for the first time, with selected works from the collection 
showcased annually. Alongside this, is rolling programme of events and 
activities; most are free. 

Activities include family events, lectures, artist talks, tours, guides, films, 
performances, opportunities to meet and work with artists, music and poetry 
events. MIMA is a partner in Plus Tate, a major national collaborative arts 
initiative for the visual arts involving Tate and 18 of the UK's most dynamic 
arts institutions. MIMA is part of Middlesbrough Council and is funded by 
Middlesbrough Council and Arts Council England.

services.tags: Primary Schools;Secondary Schools;In School & Educational Support Services
services.description:
Spotlight Training and Media has been delivering an alternative education 
programme for over six years.  The Vocational Access Programme (VAP) is a two 
year, full time course taking the students through their academic years 10 and 
11. Short courses and respite periods are also available.

The student benefits from the programme include; improvement of social skills, 
achievement of qualifications and the increased opportunities for further 
development.  On completion, most of the students have been successful in their 
progression, including; entry into college, acceptance on training programmes, 
gaining employment and joining the military forces.

Spotlight also has an up to date fully equipped media studio with facilities 
for rehearsal/recording/mixing and editing of cd and dvd. Training and 
corporate media products can be produced either in studio or on location.

British Pregnancy Advisory Service (BPAS) supports reproductive choice and 
health by advocating and providing high quality, affordable services to prevent 
unwanted pregnancies with contraception or help by offering abortion for those 
who are pregnant and don't want to fulfil this pregnancy for whatever reason. 
BPAS also offer a wide range of other reproductive health services.

BPAS is one of Britain's largest single abortion provider caring for over 
55,000 women each year. We also provide pregnancy testing, counselling, STI 
screening, contraception, sterilisation, vasectomy and vasectomy reversal 
through our 36 consultation centres and 19 clinics located throughout the UK.

BPAS also provides specialist contact centre services to the NHS such as 
Central Booking Services which speeds up access to abortion treatment across a 
range of NHS and agency providers. In addition, we offer online STI testing, 
online treatment and advice for erectile dysfunction.

Facilities include: a playroom with an extensive range of toys and equipment to stimulate and develop children, a large ktichen/diner where children are provided with healthy, nutritionally balanced meals and learn the importance of healthy eating. homework time where children are encouraged to complete any school work/reading a room dedicated to children over the age of 8 with TV, DVD, playstation and a selection of books and board games to stimulate the older child. a large secure garden with a variety of games and equipment and a playhouse.

services.orgName: Newlife Service Team (Newlife Foundation For Disabled Children)
services.description: Newlife Foundation is a UK based national charity that: Funds medical research to improve child health; Funds grants for essential equipment Offers support services via a nurse helpline; campaigns for a fairer deal for disabled children. The Nurses Services Team: The Nurse Services Team primarily help families and their children via a nurse helpline, live nurse chat and email. Equipment Grants: Newlife's grants service gives real help quickly. The Service exists to help those who need it, perhaps to buy special equipment but who would otherwise face a lengthy wait. A fast decision means that they can grant immediate help just where it's needed.The special 'Just Can't wait' service can get equipment on loan to children in 72 hours. Nurse Services Helpline: Our nurses have vast experience understanding of how difficult things can be. They cannot pass a tissue or give a hug down the phone line but they will listen and do their very best to understand.

services.orgName: Unique - The Rare Chromosome Disorder Support Group (Helpline)
services.description:
Unique is a source of information and support to families and individuals 
affected by any rare chromosome disorder and to the professionals who work with 
them. Established in 1984, Unique is a UK-based charity (1110661) but welcomes 
members worldwide. Membership of Unique is free but the group receives no 
government funding and is heavily reliant on donations and fundraising to 
continue its work. 

Unique, offers contact with families with an affected member who has the same 
rare chromosome disorder or, who has similar symptoms or practical concerns, 
irrespective of specific chromosome disorder. It produces a comprehensive range 
of family-friendly, medically-verified information guides on a variety of rare 
chromosome disorders- these are free to download on the website 
www.rarechromo.org  A  network of local contacts promote awareness of rare 
chromosome disorders to the general public and professionals. Unique 
co-ordinates families to assist in research and has password-protected 
discussion forums for registered members, it also has social networking sites 
on facebook, twitter, etc. It publishes a magazine three times a year. Unique 
hosts occasional study and family conference weekends. Unique has over 8,000 
affected families and many relevant professionals as members worldwide in 81 
countries.

services.orgName: National Organisation for Foetal Alcohol Syndrome-UK (Helpline)

Disabilities. We run family support groups, a HELP LINE, and newsletter. Carers 
are provided for children at support groups. We also provide training for 
Foetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD) Management and provide school education 
for prevention. We also have an educational DVD. We also conduct training on 
FASD for professionals all around the country .

services.description:
Working Families: Changing the way we live and work

Working Families is the UKs leading work-life balance organisation.  The charity helps working parents and carers and their employers find a better balance between responsibilities at home and work.

Our free Legal Helpline gives parents and carers advice on employment rights such as maternity and paternity leave, rights to time off in an emergency, and parental leave, as well as helping them to negotiate the flexible hours they want. We can also give basic advice on the benefits and tax credits that working parents can claim.  We also give advice on maternity discrimination and pregnancy discrimination. Our ground breaking research and campaigns seek to change the way we live and work. To that end, we also work with employers to support them in creating workplaces which encourage work-life balance for everyone

All treatments are chargeable.

The Clubhouse is ideal for business events and corporate entertaining. The Wellington Suite accommodates 120 guests and hosts conferences and large corporate functions. The Duke Suite caters for medium-size events and accommodates 60 guests buffet-style and 80 guests theatre-style. A smaller meeting room accommodates 20 delegates. services.description:
The aim of Redcar & Cleveland Borough Council is to try and keep families 
together, however there are times when this is not possible. 

Foster Care is a service provided for children and young people who are unable 
to live with their own family, and as a foster carer you will take the children 
into your own home and care for them, working in partnership with the Local 
Authority and the child's parents. 

Although this is often a temporary arrangement the child's stay can range from 
a few days to several years.

If you would like further information on becoming a foster carer please follow 
the web-link or contact:

Tel: 0800 073 8800

services.description:
Dalby Forest is situated on the southern slopes of the North York Moors 
National Park.  Dalby Forest offers over 8,000 acres of woodland to explore and 
enjoy, including enchanted woodland and play areas for children, barbecues for 
the family and plenty of way marked trails.Visitors wanting to burn off some 
energy can hire bikes and use the 55 miles of cycle trails to explore the 
forest.Go Ape adventure course, with high ropes and zip wires up among the 
trees and also Go Ape Segway  for more information visit www.goape.co.uk For 
those who like to relax, there's always a quiet corner to watch the wildlife 
and take in the fresh air and scenery.On site facilities include a Visitor 
Centre, Tree Tops Restaurant, Toilets, Meeting room, Exhibition area, Forestry 
Commission shop, Bike hire and cafe.

Discover, Experience and Enjoy Dalby Forest with our Annual Discovery pass. 
This pass is an unlimited entry for one vehicle to the forest all year round. 
Discovery Pass Holders can also take advantage of the following discounts:

Free car parking

10% discount in the Forestry Commission shop (£5 minimum spend)

Special offers at Tree Top Restaurant (see notice board for details)

10%off Christmas trees at Dalby

20% off Go Ape!

15% off Forest Holidays cabin bookings

10% discount on paint balling and multi-activity days in Dalby Forest with 
Ability Outdoors

Seasonal e-newsletter packed with news, events and activities

www.forestry.gov.uk/pass

services.orgName:
PADI International Limited
The Way the World Learns to Dive
services.description:
The PADI Discover Scuba Diving programme lets you experience the thrill of 
diving in the convenience of a swimming pool. The friendly session (which lasts 
approximately 1 hour) introduces you to the excitement of being able to breathe 
underwater. Children should be confident in the water, but they don't have to 
be super swimmers since the maximum depth is only 2m/6 ft. 

Minimum age for PADI Discover Scuba Diving is 10yrs+. A Medical Statement and a 
Certificate of Understanding must be completed by all participants or the 
parent/guardian of the participant prior to taking part. Participants must wear 
suitable swimwear. A tee shirt & shorts may be worn for extra comfort. 

To book your 2 for the price of 1 experience: 
· Download the list of participating PADI Dive Centres on the  link attached.
· Choose your local Dive Centre and contact them directly to arrange your 
Discover Scuba Diving experience. 

Don't you want to jump straight in? 

PADI 2 for 1 Terms & Conditions :
1. This offer entitles you to a free PADI Discover Scuba Diving experience when 
accompanying a participant paying full price for the same course.
2. This offer is redeemable at participating PADI-affiliated dive centres only, 
and only on production of a valid PADI 2 for 1 voucher and/or associated 
documentation obtained through an authorised PADI partner.
3. This offer is not redeemable against any other PADI service than the 
'Discover Scuba Diving' programme. 
4. The promotion close date: ongoing 
5. Participants take part in the promotion at their own risk and agree that it 
is their responsibility to arrange for relevant insurance provisions to be put 
in place. 
6. The participation of minors under the age of 18 in the promotion is subject 
to PADI's satisfaction that all necessary consents are received from the 
relevant parents/guardians. 
7. Participation in a 'Discover Scuba Diving' experience is strictly subject to 
participants first completing PADI's Discover Scuba Diving Statement to PADI's 
satisfaction and all other health and safety requirements that are required by 
PADI AND the chosen participating Dive Centre.
8. For further information please contact PADI International Limited at: PADI 
International Ltd, Unit 7, St Philips Central, Albert Road, St Philips, 
Bristol, BS2 0PD.

Children have their own playroom with all the comforts of home. Listed below are a few examples of the equipment the children have to play with. Hopefully it will give you an idea of what is on offer: ROLE PLAY - kitchen, garage, cots, dolls, highchairs, tool bench, castles etc. DRESSING UP - doctors, vets, police, action figures, princesses etc INTERACTIVE TOYS - equipment to encourage numbers, letters, colours, simple puzzle solving BOARD GAMES - bingo, matching pairs JIGSAWS/PUZZLES - wooden boards and jigsaws for all ages CONSTRUCTION - stickle bricks, wooden blocks, lego of all sizes, k-nexs FIGURES - barbie, action man, spiderman, play mobile BOOKS/SONGS - for every age range plus CDs CREATIVE PLAY - aqua draw, chalk boards, drawing boards and having access to all the equipment to create their own games ART/DESIGN - a wide range of paints, glue, pencils, crayons, pencils, play dough etc OUTDOOR PLAY - fully enclosed garden only access to garden is via the house ROLE PLAY - petrol pumps, barbeque, pushchairs, workbenches WHEELED TOYS - bikes, scooters, go karts, coupe cars BATS and BALLS - mini golf, footballs etc balancing games WATER and SAND PLAY - water and sand table, water pistols, watering cans, paddling pool OTHER OUTDOOR - seesaw, tents, ball pool, hula hoops, bubble machines etc GARDENING/PLANTING - sunflowers, plants, vegetables, cress KITCHEN/COOKING - children bake and help prepare snacks VISITS/OUTINGS - playgroups, parks, library, seaside, farm etc PLAYROOM - has a sofa and TV/DVD/Sky TV. There is also a quiet area and a sleeping area.

Julie says .... I have been a childminder since 2002. I am a member of the NCMA and have an NVQ Level 3 Nursery Nurse Certificate, First Aid, Food Hygiene, Data Protection Act 1998 and a Safe Guarding Children. I attend regular courses when available to refresh my knowledge. I provide a safe and happy environment in which children have the opportunity to learn and develop through play. Development folders of your child are available at all times for you to view which will include observations, photographs, write ups and achievements and activities the children have carried out. The folder will be handed over to you when the child leaves the setting for you to treasure. All the above is the frame work of the EYFS which MUST be carried out by all childcare providers on children aged from birth to 5 years.

services.tags: Arts & Culture;Clubs, Hobbies & Interests;Places to Visit;Community
services.description:
Preston Hall Museum 
Standing in over 100 acres of magnificent parkland, Preston Hall was built in 
1825. 

It was opened as Stockton's first public museum in 1953. Situated on the A135 - 
Yarm Road, Stockton, the museum is well sign posted. It has level access to the 
ground floor and Victorian Street and has toilet facilities for disabled 
patrons. The museum provides a wonderful opportunity to explore domestic life 
of the past with the many recreated period rooms ranging from an 1880s parlour 
to a 1960s bedsit. There is also a recreation of a typical Victorian street 
where demonstrations of traditional crafts can be seen.In addition to these 
year round displays, the museum offers a varied programme of changing 
exhibitions and special events. 

The museum is open daily 
10.00am - 4.30pm Monday to Friday 
Saturday / Sunday 11.00am - 4.30pm 
Last Admission 4.00pm 
. 

The admission fee is £1.30p for adults, and 60p for children. Concessions, 
family and group rates are available. Please note outdoor events in the Park 
are not organised by the Museums and Heritage Service and different charges may 
apply. 

More information about what's on can be obtained by contacting the Preston Hall 
Museum.

services.orgName: Saltholme - Wildlife reserve and discovery park
services.description:
Come and explore the breathtaking, state-of-the-art building with panoramic views of this huge wetland... A brilliant café - just follow your nose for freshly-brewed coffee, gooey cakes and mouthwatering meals... A great shop where you'll be able to spend a bit of pocket money or splash the cash... Three architect-designed hides to get you closer to the oodles of wildlife that call this place home, including the striking Wildlife Watchpoint which overlooks one of our busiest pools.

Still wanting more? Later in the year the walled wildlife garden designed by celebrity gardener Chris Beardshaw will be in full bloom. For the active out there, there are plenty of walks and trails to discover and a fantastic playground.

No-one's going to tell you what to do or where to go. But, if you do want our help, you only have to ask. There's a gang of friendly, passionate, well-informed folk here, whose aim is to make sure you have a great time. So you see, a visit to Saltholme is exactly what you want it to be and no two visits will be the same.

We can't wait to show off what we've got!

Saltholme is open every day except Christmas Day. From 1 April to 30 September, we're open from 10 am to 5 pm, and from 1 October to 31 March, 10 am to 4 pm.

Saltholme's friendly staff and volunteers are here to help - if you want it. One of the places you'll be able to meet them is in the Wildlife Watch Point. Our roving wardens, Emma and Toby, will be out and about with cameras, looking for amazing sights which will be shown live in the café and shop area. So, you can enjoy watching wildlife at the same time as enjoying our scrumptious food! What could be better?

We have a fantastic range of activities on offer for families throughout the year. We offer family passes which include activities like pond dipping, crafts and trails plus drinks in the cafe, all for just £12 for the whole family (2 adults and up to 3 children). Why not call into one of our three hides? Make it to the Family Hide to learn a little from the friendly staff that will often be on hand, or go for a gentle stroll down to the peaceful Saltholme Pools Hide for a better look at residents such as the great crested grebes and mute swans. In spring and summer, you'll see a variety of butterflies such as red admirals, peacocks and common blues feeding on wildflowers along the banks, and dragonflies such as common darters and migrant hawkers. From guided walks to face painting and fancy dress parades, there's sure to be an event for everyone.

Dogs are not permitted on the reserve.

Contact the reserve for more information.

services.description:
The Wensleydale Railway runs trains between Leeming Bar (near the A1/A684 jct) 
and Redmire (on the edge of the Yorkshire Dales National Park), via Bedale and 
Leyburn.  The 17 mile trip takes approximately 50 minutes. This is the first 
part of a project to restore the full 40 mile route between Northallerton (on 
the East Coast Main Line) and Garsdale (on the Settle-Carlisle Railway).  Our 
trains are usually formed of heritage diesel railcars from the 1960s, which 
have large windows and a great view of the line ahead if you sit behind the 
driver

The service is onfidential and non judgemental.  The service provides self-help

The NCT started in 1956. Since then, we have worked successfully to improve the 
experience of becoming a parent in the UK. 
We are a membership charity with over 96,000 members across the UK. Our 
strength comes from the dedication of our volunteers, who work through our 
network of branches to provide and support local services, training and 
evidence-based information for parents, families and health professionals. We 
are trusted and respected by health professionals and governments as an 
organisation that represents the needs of parents. 
Our work is funded through membership fees, fundraising activities and the 
delivery of our services. 

We work to fulfil our mission and vision of enabling all parents in the UK to 
have an enriching experience of pregnancy, birth and early parenthood. Our 
purpose is to provide support and evidence-based information in pregnancy, 
birth and early days of parenthood. We want all parents to feel confident about 
their maternity care. We campaign to improve the services and facilities for 
new parents, and provide essential services and information to give them a 
chance to make informed choices.

P.A.L.S. - Play Activities Listening Ear Support - Helping Families with 
Children on the Autistic Spectrum.

Do you have a child with autism aged 5-16 years old?
Would you like to meet with other families?
Would your child benefit from a safe place where they can play, socialise and 
make new friends?

If Yes, then come along and receive a warm welcome at P.A.L.S.

We have an excellent range of play, sports and music equipment to suit young 
people from 5-16 years of age.  A qualified special needs sports coach from 
Middlesbrough Sport-ability attends our sessions to offer appropriate games and 
sporting opportunities.  There are also a variety of quieter activities such as 
arts, crafts, board games, book corner, jigsaws, computing, play station and 
Xbox.  We also have a Sensory Room equipped with a good range of equipment to 
promote relaxation, stimulation and play, through the mediums of music, tactile 
toys, specialist lighting and inter-active equipment.  All equipment  and 
activities have been carefully selected and planned in order to encourage and 
develop coordination, creativity, social and life skills, as well as provide 
enjoyment and entertainment in a relaxed, safe and unthreatening environment.  
The programme, being specifically structured and geared to the needs of 
children on the Austistic Spectrum.  There is also a tuck shop.

Through the support and expertise of The Main Project (a support group for 
families of children on the Autistic Spectrum based at The Beverley School for 
Autistic children in Middlesbrough).  We are planning to run training seminars 
on a variety of issues relating to Autistic Spectrum Disorder.

Through P.A.L.S we can offer advice and support, the opportunity for you to 
relax and meet other parents, information and access to a resource lending 
library containing videos and books to help you understand more about 
Austistic  Spectrum Disorders.

For further information and meeting dates please telephone Alison Anderson.
services.accessDetails:
Parents & Carers only
Children only
Adult supervision required

PALS is part of our Community Programme at the Salvation Army and is open to anyone with a child on the Autistic Spectrum.  Parents can self refer.  We also receive referrals through Health and Education Authority.  PALS facilities are aimed at children 5-16 years.  This is flexible, however according to young persons abilities and needs older children are welcome and we have toys available for younger children available.

services.description:
Following a £12million revamp, The Bowes Museum at Barnard Castle is a super 
place for a family outing, whatever your age and whatever the weather! Our 
friendly staff will welcome you to fresh new galleries, displayed in both 
contemporary and traditional ways, events and exhibitions.

The Museum is full of fascinating and interesting exhibits, the most famous of 
which is the Silver Swan.  The swan, which was created over 200 years ago, is a 
life-size musical automation which delights audiences with its daily 
performance.

Built in the 19th century in the style of a French chateau, The Bowes Museum 
now boasts a fabulous Fashion & Textile Gallery, Silver & Metals Gallery, and a 
trio of amazing Picture Galleries.  The latter are among the largest gallery 
spaces in the UK and house the Museum's finest paintings.

The revamp also included a new education suite, with staff offering a wide 
range of entertaining and informative activities and family fun days.

Surrounding the museum are beautiful gardens and acres of parkland , with room 
to just stroll, picnic or be a little more energetic with one of our Bags of 
Fun, available from reception for  a refundable deposit.  The grounds also 
contain an outdoor Story Garden, with guest storytellers telling amazing tales 
during the peak months.

Whether rain or sun, it's fun, fun, fun at the Bowes Museum!

services.serviceName: Bond Guarantee Scheme Housing Client Services
services.description:
The scheme works in partnership with local landlords (and agents) who are 
members of the Council's Landlord Charter to help people secure rented 
accommodation within the private sector. The Bond Guarantee will guarantee up 
to 4 weeks rent, up to a maximum of £500, which the landlord may make a claim 
against should there be damage or theft at the end of the tenancy. 
Qualification criteria must be met by all applicants, making an application 
does not guarantee that you will be successful in securing a Bond Guarantee 
Certificate.
services.accessDetails:
Parents & Carers only

We aim to help qualifying single people over 18 years of age, couples and families, who urgently need housing, to move into privately rented accommodation. Where they are unable to find a cash deposit required by a landlord, our scheme can provide a Bond Guarantee Certificate.

Around one in five young people in the UK are not in work, education or training. Youth unemployment costs the UK economy £10 million a day in lost productivity, while youth crime costs £1 billion every year. We address this by giving practical and financial support to the young people who need it most. We help develop key skills, confidence and motivation, enabling young people to move into work, education or training.

Programmes to support young people

We run programmes that encourage young people to take responsibility for themselves  helping them build the life they choose rather than the one theyve ended up with: The Business Programme provides money and support to help young people start up in business. The Team Programme is a 12-week personal development course, offering work experience, qualifications, practical skills, community projects and a residential week. Get Intos are short courses offering intensive training and experience in a specific sector to help young people get a job. Development Awards are small grants to enable young people to access education, training or work. Community Cash Awards are grants to help young people set up a project that will benefit their community. xl clubs give 14-16 year olds who are at risk of truanting, exclusion and underachievement a say in their education. They aim to improve attendance, motivation and social skills. We Help:

Unemployed young people

A wealth of research indicates that lower educational attainment and lack of formal qualifications make it much more difficult to secure full-time employment. To help those with few or no qualifications to build skills, confidence and find employment, we provide personal development opportunities. To assist young people trying to move into a job, training or education - but lacking the money to do so - we give Development Awards.

Young people underachieving in education

5.4% of 15 year olds in England leave school with no qualifications and nearly 25% have fewer than five GCSEs. To combat school-related challenges such as truancy, exclusions and poor performance, we run xl clubs within 300 schools across the UK.

Young people leaving care

Approximately 8,000 young people leave care more vulnerable than most. They are more likely to have no qualifications or low basic skills, or be unemployed or homeless.

Young offenders and ex-offenders

According to a Home Office survey, 3.95% of the 16-25 population have offended. The Prince's Trust does not run programmes exclusively for young offenders and ex-offenders, but we recognise the strength of our programmes to help them break the offending cycle and fulfil their aspirations.
