services.tags: Debt & Money Advice;Rights & Legal Issues;Support Groups & Helplines
services.description:
Consumer Direct is the government funded telephone and online service offering 
information and advice on consumer issues. There are 11 regional offices across 
Great Britain and we have one here in the North East. Consumer Direct is a 
government backed telephone and online consumer advice  service, which is 
supported by all 12 local authorities in the North East, and  by the Office of 
Fair Trading.

We can advise you on a number of various topics regarding goods and services,  
how to make a complaint and can also give you pre-shopping advice, handy for 
when shopping for christmas presents!

We provide clear, practical, impartial advice to help you sort out problems 
and  disagreements you may be having with suppliers of goods or services.

We can:

Provide pre-shopping advice before you by goods or services
Explain your consumer rights.
Advise you if you have a problem or disagreement with a trader.
Help you make a complaint about a trader that you believe has done something 
wrong (although we will not complain on your behalf)
Provide general advice on how to avoid unscrupulous traders or "cowboys"
Explain consumer related issues such as warranties, buying on credit, internet 
shopping, refunds and replacements.
Provide advice on avoiding trading scams and rip-offs.
Direct you to a regulator or other organisation if it is better to assist you.
Refer your case to your local authority Trading Standards Services or similar 
agency if they are better suited to assist you.

Consumer Direct provides first tier advice and information on a wide range of 
consumer problems, and has trained advisers who are friendly and ready to 
offer  tailored advice.

Consumer Direct will deal with each caller's problems or questions 
individually.  We will provide an honest, impartial assessment of the situation 
and where possible, we will recommend a clear course of action to follow.
services.accessDetails:
This is a government funded telephone and online service.  There is no face to face contact, this service deals with emails and cases over the telephone.

Access this service by calling 08454 04 05 06 or by visiting www.consumerdirect.gov.uk/contact?action=complain where an advisor will contact you via email

services.serviceName: Short Breaks for Carers of Disabled Children
services.description:
The Breaks for Carers of Disabled Children Duty 2010 places a legal obligation on the Local Authority to provide breaks for carers of disabled children.

A short break is an opportunity for children and young people to spend time away from their parents and carers to take part in enjoyable activities and meet up with friends while being appropriately cared for. It provides a break for parents and carers from their caring responsibilities, using the time to enjoy leisure or learning activities, catch up with tasks to help with the day-to-day running of their home, spend time with other family members or to simply relax and recharge their batteries. This also gives children and young people the chance to enjoy new leisure activities and meet up with friends.

Short Breaks can be accessed in a number of ways. For more information about Short Breaks and Transitions:-

Call the Families' Information Service on 0800 073 8800 Look at our Short Breaks Menu "this is Short Breaks", available on the Families' Guide website on the Disabled Children's services page. Read our Short Breaks Statement on the Council Website: www.redcar-cleveland.gov.uk.

Guisborough Photo Group was formed in 1952 , as a section of Wilton I.C.I. 
Recreation Club, for  workers only. It is now  a club open to all, whatever 
their level of photographic skills. We meet on Thursday evenings at 7.30, 
during our season, which runs from September to April. The meetings are held at 
Methodist Church Hall, Westgate, Guisborough. In pleasant surroundings with a 
large lecture room and free car parking on Westgate.

As a friendly club, with Approx 50 members, we can attract high quality 
lecturers and judges to our events. The Programme  page shows the variety and 
number of meetings that we hold during the season. 
We know that to thrive as a club it is necessary to attract new members, 
whether they are experienced photographers or beginners. For beginners we hold 
several tuition and advice evenings during the year and we are always pleased 
to answer questions. If you think that we are the type of club that might 
interest you then come along to a couple of meetings. We won't hassle you to 
join, but we will be pleased to meet you.

services.description:
This Service is available to children attending mainstream schools, aged 4-16 
years of age, who have delayed or impaired functional skills that impact on 
activities of daily living.   These difficulties may be associated with 
physical disability, developmental delay, impaired or delayed hand function, 
handwriting difficulties, movement or motor co-ordination difficulties (DCD, 
dyspraxia), sensory modulation, visual perception, self-care/independence 
skills and functional mobility.   This Service provides assessment, advice 
and/or therapy intervention, as appropriate.

services.description:
Aiming High for Disabled Children (AHDC), launched in May 2007, is the 
transformation programme for disabled children's services. 

Parents, carers and families are the most important influence on outcomes for 
children and young people. The Every Child Matters: Change for Children 
programme aims to ensure that support for parents becomes routine, particularly 
at key points in a child or young person's life.

Small Steps = Big Changes is the name given to the group of parents and carers 
of disabled children in Redcar and Cleveland, working to have their say about 
services, reflecting their children's wishes and improves services.

Please find attached information fact sheets that have been developed in

children with a disability or an additional need.

services.description:
The museum promotes the ironstone heritage of the region with a fully guided 
tour led by knowledgeable volunteers through the original
 buildings of the Loftus Mine. Other facilities include a first floor education 
room for activities and events.
services.accessDetails:
Adult supervision required

Health and safety on-site; all visitors (from 3 years and up) are issued with hard hats which must be worn at all times. The guided tours go down in to the North Drift tunnel. Throughout the tour, the floor surfaces are uneven, narrow and sloping in places and the dark room simulates a complete blackout, as experienced in the working mine.  Guided tour more suitable for age 3 up but babies are welcome to accompany families.

services.description:
The Primary Care Hospital is a user friendly, state of the art facility. The 
site benefits from: general practice, community services, outpatients, elderly 
care, an on site pharmacy, clinical areas, supporting therapies and a cafe. It 
is easily accessible by public transport and car with nearly 200 secure free 
car parking spaces. 

Redcar Primary Care Hospital provides services that were previously available 
at Stead Primary Care Hospital as well as a range of additional facilities.  
These include an in patient ward with 32 single en-suite bedrooms, 
physiotherapy department with rehabilitation gym and hydrotherapy pool, day 
theatre and endoscopy suite, diagnostic suite with x-ray and ultrasound, an 
Urgent Care Unit and five GP practices.

services.tags: Finding a Job;Debt & Money Advice;Benefits & Welfare Rights
services.description:
Jobcentre Plus is a government agency supporting people of working age from 
welfare into work, and helping employers to fill their vacancies. We are part 
of the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP ) and play a major role in 
supporting the Department's aim to 'promote opportunity and  independance for 
all through modern, customer-focused services'.

Our key objectives are to:
Increase the effective supply of labour by promoting work as the best form of 
welfare and helping unemployed and economically inactive people move into 
employment. Work towards parity of outcomes for ethnic minority customers. Pay 
customers the correct benefit at the right time and protect the benefit system 
from fraud, error and abuse. Provide high-quality and demand-led services to 
employers, which help fill job vacancies quickly and effectively with 
well-prepared and motivated employees. Help people facing the greatest barriers 
to employment to compete effectively in the labour market and move into and 
remain in work. Improve continuously the quality, accessibility and delivery of 
services to all customers. Ensure that people receiving working age benefits 
fulfil their responsibilities while providing appropriate help and support for 
those without work. Increase Jobcentre Plus overall productivity, efficiency 
and effectiveness.
services.contactTel: Contact:  National Jobcentre Plus 0845 604 3719 (who will then connect you to Redcar Jobcentre)  or to enquire about your benefit: 0845 600 1651

services.description:
Beverley offers childcare all year, full term, half term, early mornings, before/after school, afternoons, weekends, part-time, school holidays, evening and emergency. Offers pick up/drop off from Belmont Primary School and Highcliffe Primary schools.

I am a member of Redcar and Cleveland Quality Assured Children Come First childminding network as well as being a member of the NCMA National Childminding Association. I am registered with OFSTED and have my Husband Registered as my Full-time Assistant. I am pleased to say that during our last two inspections we have received an `Outstanding`grading. More recently I became a facilitator for the NCMA local supporting childminders within the local area with paperwork as well as organising Group activities. I live at home with my Husband who is my full-time assistant as well as my three children aged 22, 17 and 15. We have a very friendly cocker spaniel dog called Ruby. I Accepts Busy Bee Vouchers, Accor and Fidelity NHS Vouchers. I provide a wide variety of stimulating and exciting activities for children of all ages, all of which are covered within the schools foundation stage. These include: Baking, arts & crafts, visiting local groups, special outings during the school holidays, trampoline, play house, water tray, sand tray, bikes, cars, prams etc. We also have an area for quiet time where the children are able to have a sleep, read books, sit and watch a little television or perhaps just have cuddles. Each child has a Daily Journal and a personnel file which is shared on a regular basis with each child's parents so that we can discuss with the parents the developmental stage their child/children are at and discuss the individual child's next steps.We provide a healthy diet for the children which includes, breakfast, lunch and tea as well as snacks and drinks throughout the day. We are able to work alongside anybody that needs a special diet as we would just incorporate this into our menue plans. We run our meals on a five week rota, all of which is available for parents to view on our their parents notice-board. We hold all relevant qualifications that are needed and these can be seen in detail within our Welcome Booklet.

services.description:
Teesside Community Services and Physical Disabilities Floating Support for people living in Hartlepool and Redcar & Cleveland.

Stonham's Community Services Team is a Generic Floating Support Service and aims to enable single people, lone parents, older people and families to successfully maintain their accomodation, promote personal and social development and encourage greater independence within the community.The service is tailored to support individuals to identify and reach their own goals and aspirations. A Support Plan is drawn up with each client who identifies achievable goals and outcomes in relation to each individuals needs, abilities and circumstances. Regular support meetings take place to help clients stay on track with their goals. The support plan is reviewed at least every 3 months or sooner if the client request this or circumstances change.

Stonham Community Services can provide support and advice with the following:

Liaise with agencies, both statutory and voluntary e.g. GP's, Social Services Housing Officers

Support and help to find suitable accommodation

Give advice with neighbour disputes, clarify tenancy obligations and help deal with incidents of harassment

Provide help with utility connections and supply

Help and advice with benefits, income maximisation, budgeting and debt advice

Advice on developing daily living skills e.g. keeping appointments, shopping, house maintenance

Advice on obtaining employment, education and training opportunities

Signpost to specialist care and counselling service e.g. alcohol, drugs, domestic violence

Personal well-being:we work with clients in positive and practical way to promote their personal well-being

Referrals can be made by statutory and voluntary agencies, including Local Authorities, Social Services, housing providers, advice and resource centres. Potential clients can also self-refer by post or by telephone.

Finding Understanding & Supporting Emotions (F.U.S.E.) Ltd is a not for profit 
Social Enterprise that offers support directly to the family and young people 
or through a third party. F.U.S.E. Ltd is here to support you and your family; 
whilst we are unable to answer all your questions or concerns on this website, 
we can outline some of the support that we can provide. 

Self-Esteem, whether it is called self-worth, self-belief or self-confidence, 
it always comes back to the concept of the self. Some of us do get caught in a 
cycle of  low self-esteem and cannot get out of it; this is where F.U.S.E. Ltd 
can help.

Management of Anger In many ways, anger is a good thing; not a statement you 
will see very often, but a very true one. The management or recognition of ones 
anger and the control or use of it is the issue that is most frequently 
identified as Anger Management problems. We all develop periods of anger and 
most of us know this and have developed strategies to manage it, but some of us 
can't quite get there and could really do with support in developing those 
strategies; this is where F.U.S.E. ltd can help.

I provide a warm, friendly and safe and stimulating environment, making your 
child feel a part of the family.  I am 35 years old, married to Karl and we 
have 2 children, a girl aged 11 and a baby under 2 years.  My aim is to offer 
good quality care that meets the needs of the individual child.  I operate on 
an equal opportunities service, teaching your child/children through play which 
includes an educational goal.  Learning and developing is very rewarding to 
your child and gives me job satisfaction. I work with the parent/carer to make 
the experience a happy/enjoyable stay for your child.
I have a lot of activities, for example:  painting, glueing, playdough, 
jigsaws, reading, books, musical instruments, construction toys, role play,

I am a member of NCMA - National Childminding Association and I have

First Aid Training.  I have worked in childcare for about 17 years and I would 
like to share my knowledge and experience with you to care for your child.  I 
promote a happy environment, good relationship with families and children.  I 
also drive and am available to take/pick up from local nurseries and schools

services.orgName: Childminders - Rachel Donnelly & Amanda Reynolds (Busy Bees Childminding)
services.description:
I offer care before and after school, school holidays and wraparound, emergency 
cover, full-time, all year, early mornings. 

Can pick up/drop off from Coatham Primary, St Bede's RC Primary and Ings Farm 
Primary schools (and most nurseries/schools if available)

Rachel lives and works jointly with Amanda as Busy Bees Childminding.

I want to welcome your family into my home.  What I offer you and your child is 
much more than just a baby-sitting service.  I offer an extended family support 
system that nurtures all of us.  A unique family child care setting that caters 
to the emotional and developmental needs of all children.  I provide nurturing, 
loving care in a professional manner.
It is often difficult for working parents to balance all the commitments and 
responsibilities in their lives.  When your child is at my home, you will 
receive peace of mind knowing that your child is being loved and taken care of 
much in the same fashion that you yourself would provide.  I offer a safe, 
loving environment where your child will be accepted, loved, nurtured, and 
stimulated.  Somewhere you know that your child will be respected and will be 
able to be a "child".
I use my knowledge to offer stimulating, developmental activities when your 
child is ready for them.  They include music and movement, outdoor play, 
practical life and sensory activities, arts and crafts, pre-reading and 
pre-math skills, quiet story and sharing times, manipulative, dramatic play, 
and lots of laughter.
I strive to meet your child's physical, intellectual, social and emotional 
needs.  I feel children learn best in a loving, organized, natural learning 
environment.  Your child will learn something new everyday by being part of our 
extended family.  Your child will learn important values such as patience, 
sharing, responsibility, compassion for self and others, communication and 
teamwork.  They will also learn the basics of education such as recognizing 
their alphabet, numbers, colours, shapes, and how to paint, play with dough, 
cut with scissors, colour with crayons, and the beginning stages of reading.  
They will always be encouraged to use their imagination wile creating artwork, 
manipulating their own ideas and thoughts on paper, or other concrete 
materials.
My commitment to you starts with your commitment to me.  For this support to 
thrive, we must have an open, honest communication.  Please feel free to share 
with me your concerns, problems and situations that will affect your child.
To help my childcare business operate smoothly, you will need to comply with my 
policies and our contract of care.  I want you to be able to make your decision 
about childcare based on the terms that I provide. 
I am looking forward to working with you to provide the best possible care for 
your child, here at Busy Bees Childminding.

Finchale is a national, specialist, residential training College and registered 
charity. The College originally started life as a hotel, purpose built in 1928. 
In 1943 it was bought by Sir John Priestman and set up as a rehabilitation 
hospital for injured serviceman returning from the war and we continue to 
support veterans today.

We stand in our own 13.5 acres of grounds approximately 3 miles from the centre 
of Durham City and work with a wide range of unemployed adults (18+) who need 
to retrain to gain employment of 16 hours or more a week. Our job is to support 
potential candidates with a range of disability and mental health issues or who 
have a range of barriers stopping them returning to the employment market.

Finchale has an established local and national reputation for providing high 
quality training. Our candidates have an excellent record of achievement and we 
encourage a supportive environment with a responsible and professional approach 
to training. Finchale is a multi-sector specialist representing candidates 
across a number of market sectors.

Potential candidates can arrange a visit to Finchale on our visitors' afternoon 
every Wednesday at 2.00pm to view prospective training areas and residential 
facilities. To book a place or ask for prospectus please contact the main 
reception on 0191 3862634.

Disabled car parking and other requirements are available and the College have 
a mini-bus pick up service from local bus and train services.

Candidates who are interested in any of our programmes need to contact the 
Disability Employment Advisor at their local Jobcentre Plus office who can 
discuss and make the application on their behalf. (You do not have to be 
formally registered as disabled to come to Finchale.) Each programme is funded 
principally through Jobcentre Plus and thus potential candidates are not 
expected to meet any of the costs.
services.accessDetails: Must be unemployed with a disability or barrier to employment.  Must apply via a Disability Employment Adviser at local Jobcentre.
services.referralOnlyDetails: Via JobCentre Plus

services.description:

Voluntary contributions to the cost of venue hire and refreshments are welcome.
services.referralOnlyDetails: The  North East Support Group which is affiliated to the national charity Tourettes Action is only open to children and young people under 21 with a clinical diagnosis of Tourette Syndrome, and their families.  Professionals may also be invited to events and activities.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails:
For child protection reasons participation is only available to those registered (free of charge). Email jac.campbell@homecall.co.uk or phone 07501 620200.
The North East Support Group, which is affiliated to the national charity Tourettes Action, welcomes all children and young people under 21 with a clinical diagnosis of Tourette Syndrome, and their families.

services.description:
I have been a member of the National Childminding Association since 1993 when I 
began childminding.  I offer a friendly, professional and flexible service 
tailored to meet individual children and their families.  My home has a warm 
welcoming environment and is within walking distance of local amenities, 
including shops, schools and parks.  I have a dedicated play room where the 
children can access the toys as and when they wish.  In the play room there are 
board games, books, music, jigsaws, construction, home corner toys and 
arts/crafts amongst others.  I also have a large enclosed and safe rear garden 
which has a wide range of outdoor toys, including a slide, car, bikes, scooters 
and balls etc.  My son 21, and daughter 15 also live with me.  I also have a 
dog.  My son works full time and holds a valid enhanced CRB certificate.  My 
daughter currently attends the local senior school.
I have full use of a car with Business Insurance cover.  I can use this to take 
the children to a great range of activities both inside and out and I regularly 
visit soft play centres, mother and toddler groups, local library, beaches and 
parks.  In addition to this I use it to collect and drop off children at 
schools and nurseries.
I have the following qualifications which underpin my 18 years experience:
* Paediatric First Aid
* Certificate in Playgroup Practice
* City and Guilds in Caring for Children
* Level 2 Award in Healthier Food and Special Diets
* Certificate for Home Fire safety from Cleveland Fire Brigade.

I also accept Busy Bees Childcare vouchers.

services.description:
Payroll and Fund Management Assistance for Families with Disabled Children.   
We provide a suite of services for families with disabled children that employ 
a carer or PA via a Local Authority Direct Payment or Individual Budget. You 
can use our services if you require assistance to:
Ensure your employees are paid on time
Calculate tax and National Insurance
Provide them with payslips
Report to HM Revenue and Customs
Meet your obligations as an employer 
Apply for Enhanced CRB checks on your behalf

For those who would eventually like to become independent and run their own 
payroll system from home, we offer a complete set up service and training 
alongside our help, on a sliding scale of charges over the period of one year. 

For those that have allowed their DP to slip into difficulty, we offer tailor 
made 'rescue packages' to get you back on track. 

Home consultations are standard and all conversations are private and 
confidential.

services.description:
Disabled Parents Network (DPN) is a national organisation of and for disabled 
people who are parents or who hope to become parents, and their families, 
friends and supporters. DPN is run by volunteers, with a small number of paid 
employees.

We are here for all parents, including parents actual or perceived physical, 
sensory, emotional or learning impairment; long-term illness; HIV; drug or 
alcohol dependence; or a person with a mental health issue.

We believe that disabled people have the right to have children and that they 
should be properly supported to carry out that right at each stage of parenting.

Disabled Parents Network will do its best to make sure that it works well for 
all disabled parents and that everyone who wants to can play a part, whatever 
their family situation, background or disability.

Our broad purpose is to:

Provide peer support, information and advice to disabled parents.

Remove the physical and social barriers limiting or denying disabled parents 
ability to take part in society on an equal basis with non disabled parents.

Provide or assist in the training of disabled parents, volunteers and others 
working with them and the advancement of education of the general public.

Please note we are not an organisation which supports parents of disabled 
children.


DPN provides information, advice and peer support to disabled parents, their 
families and supporters. We campaign on a local and national level to improve 
services for disabled parents.

We also provide training and workshop facilitation to social and health 
professionals.

If you feel we can help please contact us. 



DPN based at Suite 37-40 Cherry Orchard North, Swindon, SN2 8UH.       
Registered Charity 1087662

services.description:
What is Targeted Youth Support (TYS) ?

TYS is part of Redcar & Cleveland Borough Council Integrated Youth Support Services. The main aim of TYS is to identify young people aged between 1116, experiencing a variety of difficulties or issues. TYS aims to ensure all agencies work together to support young people and help them on their path to success.

Who is TYS aimed at ?

TYS is aimed at young people between the ages of 11 and 16 (up to 25 for those with disabilities) who are experiencing issues or taking risks and require help and support to prevent their issues escalating. Young people may have issues relating to: · Alcohol and Substance Misuse · Teenage Pregnancy · Antisocial Behaviour · Disengaging with School TYS will provide a co-ordinated and effective response to the needs of individual young people.

Who can make a referral to TYS ?

Anyone can make a referral. We accept referrals from professionals working with young people, parents or carers and young people themselves.

How do I make a referral to TYS ?

Easy, read the guidance notes and complete the referral form attached. When the TYS referral is completed and signed, just send it back to the team.

Is consent from young people required ?

Yes. Support offered through TYS will always be on a voluntary basis and the consent of young people to participate must be received. Young people and their families must be willing to engage with the services and support offered.

What happens to your referral ?

As most people are aware, domestic abuse is normally associated with having only female victims. One little known fact is that up to 18% (1 in 6) of men suffer some form of abuse at the hands of their partners during their lifetime. Another popular misconception, is that domestic abuse consists solely of violence towards a partner, however domestic abuse has many varied facets, which can include: being continually humiliated, criticised, and shouted at by your partner, constant fear of your partner, partner controls everything, the feeling of helplessness in the relationship, ill treatment which you're embarrassed to disclose to your friends/family, the with-holding finances / money, also sexual abuse including using and with-holding sex as a form of punishment.

We are finding that more men are now finding the strength to come forward and ask for support after suffering domestic abuse from either a female or male partner, which is why we are now offering a male support group in the Teesside area.

For ages 14 - 24 yrs we offer a 12 week rolling programme of support for boys/men who can come along at any time by dropping in to our office at United Reformed Church Hall in Redcar.

services.description:
Want more information on child maintenance? Child Maintenance Options is a free and confidential service to help child maintenance work for you.

At Child Maintenance Options, we provide impartial information and support to help both parents make informed choices about child maintenance.

The fact that we're impartial means we are here to help both parents and we aren't biased towards any one way of arranging child maintenance.

We're here to help you:

if you're separating from the other parent or are not living with them and you need to set up a child maintenance arrangement

if you're thinking of switching from an arrangement using the Child Support Agency (CSA) to a family-based arrangement, or the other way round

if your child maintenance arrangement has broken down or is not working as you'd like it to.We can also offer practical information in areas linked to child maintenance, such as housing, employment and money. Although we're not experts in these areas, we can put you in touch with specialist organisations that can provide help and advice.

If you're a guardian, relative or friend, or if you have a professional interest in finding out more about child maintenance, we may also be able to help you.

services.description:
Christians Against Poverty (CAP) is a national charity that offers a free, 
award winning debt counselling service through local centres to those 
struggling with debt. The service is for anyone regardless of religious 
beliefs, age, gender, race, sexual orientation or disability. Ring our bookings 
line to make an appointment with a local CAP Debt Coach to come and visit you 
in your own home. CAP have already helped thousands of people become debt free 
and will support and help anyone who lives within the catchment area of one of 
our CAP Debt Centres.
services.accessDetails: We are unable to help people whose only source of income is from self-employment.
services.referralOnlyDetails: People must be in debt and be willing to consent to a home visit by a Debt Coach. It does not matter how much debt someone is in or how much income they receive.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: Call our freephone number to speak to our new client enquiries team. They will explain the service, answer any questions and book an appointment for Linda to come and visit you.

services.description:
The Haven Gypsy/Traveller Site, South Bank 

This is a permanent residential Gypsy and Traveller site which consists of 13 
pitches including a Warden Pitch.

Details of the site are

In line with people living in rented bricks and mortar housing, occupants of 
the site pay rent, council tax, water rates and electricity charges.

Each pitch includes an amenity unit, containing a toilet, bath and kitchen 
area. There is no sleeping accommodation as occupants will sleep in their 
caravans.

Travellers Education Services assist in registering children into local 
schools. (Full details in the Gypsy and Traveller Strategy which is available 
on the website)

Health (Middlesbrough Primary Care Team , Surestart , Connexions, Adult 
Education, Low Grange Health Village to deliver their services plus others 
deliver their services to occupants at the site.

The site is now run on a Lease basis by Mr Louis Welch. Louis is an experienced 
local site operator who is keen to develop and expand Gypsy and Traveller 
facilities within the site.

If you would like some further information on the site or details of

services.description: Family Wise is a service to help support you, and members of your family, on the road towards work. We recognise that the transition to work can be a daunting time. Family Wise offers a comprehensive information, advice and support service that will help you, and members of your family, identify and move towards finding jobs that are right for you. We will work with you as individuals , and as a family, to help you build on strengths to enable you, and your family, to realise your full potential. To qualify for our support, at least one member of your family must be in receipt of a working age benefit, e.g. Jobseeker's Allowance, Income Support. How we Help you and Your Family : Personalised Service Your family will be assigned your own personal Family Coach. Your Family Coach is dedicated to supporting you, and your family members, and will be you main point of contact for as long as you remain with the service.

services.description: Sleep Sense provides a holistic sleep service, working with individuals, families and family practitioners to identify and address sleep and sensory issues, in the North East and North Yorkshire. We provide: One-to-one bespoke support Information, tools & resources Training and workshops Trained personal assistants Support with funding Referral and sign posting to other services Those who experience sleep problems often feel very isolated when relationships, work and education suffer. Families are more likely to have financial and health problems, with the whole family being affected by disability and challenging behaviour, we will work with any referral to identify your needs in the North East and North Yorkshire. Our support can normalise the problem, reduce isolation and eliminate or reduce the effect of these problems.

services.description:
THIS SERVICE IS OPEN TO ALL WHO LIVE , WORK AND LEARN IN REDCAR AND CLEVELAND 
BOROUGH. ALL VISITORS WELCOME.

Redcar and Cleveland Library Service aims to provide a comprehensive, efficient 
and modern library service to all who live, work or study in the Borough by:
Providing a Branch Library or Mobile Library Stop within easy reach of every 
household.
Providing all library users with access to a good, well-balanced stock in all 
formats, including books, sound recordings and DVD's.
Information on all subjects.
Public access to IT and the internet in all libraries subject to fees of £1.00 
for half an hour, £3.00 for 3 months, £10.00 for year. Please note that all 
junior members (up to the age of 18) can access the internet free of charge 
from library computers (subject to parental permission being granted to use the 
public pcs).
Ensuring all our libraries are safe friendly, welcoming and full accessible to 
all members of the public.
To provide a high quality, responsive service to the children and young people 
of Redcar and Cleveland, which actively seeks to meet their needs as 
individuals, whatever their age or stage of development by providing books, 
information and support from friendly, trained staff.

services.description:
Looking for information about children's speech, language and communication?

Call 020 7843 2544 to arrange a free phone call from one of our speech and 
language therapists I CAN Help Enquiry Service on to or you can email your 
questions to enquiries@ican.org.uk

We can help explain any aspect of children's talking and communication 
development that you may be concerned about. We can also talk you through ages 
and stages and what you can do to help your child and get the right support.

We have helped hundreds of parents and practitioners with a wide range of 
queries:
Thank you, you have answered my queries 100%. The resources will be a big help 
for parents.

We have helped hundreds of parents and childminders, teachers and SEN staff 
with a wide range of queries, giving useful tips, resources, relevant 
activities and signposting to helpful organisations. This is a great service to 
recommend to friends, colleagues and any parents you know.

Visit www.ican.org.uk/help for more information and to read our factsheets and 
frequently asked questions.

with disabilities, both learning and physical, within Redcar and Cleveland. 
Access to services from Children's Services is through referral and subsequent 
assessment by the Team.

services.description:
Contact a Family is the only UK wide charity providing advice, information and 
support to the parents/carers of all disabled children aged 0 to 19. We also 
enable parents/carers to get in contact with other families, both on a local 
and national basis.

Contact a Family North East supports families across the whole of the region. 
We provide information on a wide range of issues including specific condition 
information, where to go locally for help and support and links to national and 
local parents support groups.  We run workshops for parents/carers; offer 
advice and support to new and existing parent support groups in the region and 
help parents/carers to become involved in shaping the local services that their 
disabled children need.

Contact a Family also produce a range of publications including free quarterly 
regional newsletters and weekly email bulletins which contain details of local 
and national news, leisure ideas, events and local support group information.

Middlesbrough Sportability Club was formed in 2003,to provide sport and 
leisurely activities for children with disabilities aged
	 between 8 and 19 years of age. It is open to all young people with a 
learning disability, as well as physical or sensory impairments.

Get ready!   It's all go, go, go for super-fun family adventure at Beamish 
Wild!  Zoom on zip wires, build dens, watch awesome flying shows, scramble the 
25ft tree climb and become a modern day Robin Hood archer.  

With over 20 activities based in ancient woodland, you'll discover the most 
amazing and different family day out.  And if that wasn't enough, Beamish Wild 
is also home to the largest Bird of Prey Centre in the North East with 70 
feathered friends; get extra close in the Owl Encounters or book in advance for 
a special Hawk Walk.

If you are over 10, you'll find plenty of fun at Beamish Wild too on the High 
Ropes Course.  Just upgrade your Adventure Park ticket to swing through the 
air, brave Burma bridge or confront the 45ft power fan.  And the best news of 
all is that mum and dad can watch from the ground too.

With so much to do, you'll need to refuel your adventure!  Choose either the 
Tree Tops Cafe(serving delicious 90 second pizzas) or The Stables Bar and 
Restaurant, offering an array of meals and snacks.

Open daily from 10 am.  Beamish Wild Adventure Park, Stanley, County Durham, 
DH9 OYB. Visit  www.beamishwild.co.uk for more information  or call 01207 233 
733.

services.description:
My name is Jo, from Guisborough, and I am a fully qualified Childminder and 
Nursery Nurse with my NNEB certification, Level 3 NVQ and Advanced 
Apprenticeship in Childcare, Learning and Development.  I am Ofsted registered 
and a member of the Redcar & Cleveland, Quality Assured, Children Come first 
network, and the Aiming High for Disabled Children network (this means that 
regular checks are made by a co-ordinator to ensure parents that I am providing 
100% quality care).  I have a commitment to continued professional development 
through regular training with the networks.

I have worked as a childminder for since 2006  and before that, in primary 
school for 17 years.  This included working with children with special needs, 
including ADHD and Aspergers.

I have a up to date Paediatric First Aid Certificate and Public Liability 
insurance as required by Ofsted and I am working under the EYFS, with 
individual planning and observations for each child under 5.  I provide a wide 
variety of stimulating and exciting activities for children of all ages, for 
example, a large lawned and fenced in garden with outdoor play equipment 
including a 13ft trampoline and enclosure and a new wooden Wendy House.  
Baking, play dough, painting, drawing, computing, art and craft, TV/DVDs and 
Wii with Wii fit, sand, gardening, dressing up, books, toys, games, ball pool 
and plenty more!

We go on trips to feed the ducks, down to the beach, to farms etc  Walks to the 
woods, to the park and the shops.    I attend the local playgroup and meet up 
with other childminders and their children. I'm married with two daughters, and 
have lived in the local area since childhood.  My husband is registered as my 
assistant and is CRB checked.  He has his Paediatric First Aid Certificate and 
he helps out on his days off.  I live next door to the local park, which we 
love to visit.  I have 3 friendly cats, 2 adult guinea pigs plus 3 babies.  a 
tropical fish tank and I am in the process of getting a bearded dragon lizard.  
 We have a non-smoking household and I have a full driving license with 
business cover on my 7 seater car.  

I offer care full time, part time, full days, before and after school, holiday 
cover, school holidays and emergency cover.  I offer school drop offs and 
pickups from the following schools in Guisborough:  St Paulinus RC Primary, 
Highcliffe Primary, Galley Hill Primary and Guisborough Montessori.

I accept Busy Bees vouchers (Computershare vouchers ltd), Accor childcare 
vouchers and kiddicare vouchers and You at Work vouchers as well as BAC 
transfers and cash. For more details, please see my website:  
www.jowinspear.co.uk
For more information please contact Families' Information Service.

services.description:
AFASIC is a UK wide charity, established in 1968, to help those children and 
young people affected by the hidden disability of speech, language and 
communication impairments. 

AFASIC provides support and information to enable children, young people and 
their families to access appropriate services, and works with statutory and 
voluntary agencies to raise awareness and create better services.

AFASIC runs a national Helpline 0845 355 55 77 to provide information to 
parents and others, about how to access appropriate support for children with 
speech and language impairments.

AFASIC has an interactive website www.afasic.org.uk packed full of information.

AFASIC produces a range of information sheets, leaflets and publications which 
bring important information to parents/carers, young people with speech and 
language impairments and the professionals who work with them.  A number of our 
publications can be printed from our website free of charge.

AFASIC has local support groups and points of contact across the UK that 
provide local information, support and activities.

AFASIC organises a wide range of conferences, workshops and in-service training 
for parents, carers and professionals.

AFASIC Youth Zone has a number of projects involving young people including 
activity days, youth sessions, message board, and publications. There's plenty 
to get involved with.

Research, policy and campaigns - AFASIC works with central and local government 
to improve education and support for children and young people with speech, 
language and communication impairments.  It supports research projects, often 
working in partnership with other organisations.

services.description:
Gillbrook Academy are a growing 11  19 years academy with improving results 
and fantastic new facilities set in magnificent grounds.

The curriculum we offer provides a broad balanced approach to learning in Key 
Stage 3 with an emphasis on developing independent learners. Individual advice 
and guidance leads on to a highly personalised Key Stage 4 curriculum which 
allows each and every student to achieve their full potential. 

The courses are specifically designed with progression to the Sixth Form 
Experience and further education colleges in mind. Our Sixth Form provision has 
a highly successful record in preparing students for university and wide 
ranging opportunities in the work force.We have an excellent pastoral structure 
which ensures that child well being is at the heart of all we do. Parents are 
able to contact the academy at any time to enquire about the progress of their 
child. Regular meetings are arranged to enhance the strong partnership between 
home and the academy.

As an AET Academy we collaborate across the country with other Academies but 
principally with our neighbour Eston Park Academy. The two academies are 
governed by a single Governing Board who will arrange the amalgamation of the 
two academies into a single Academy in the near future.

The Learning Disability Child Adolescent Mental Health Service ( LD CAMHS) 
provides support for children and young people up to the age of 18 years and 
their families, where the child or young person is experiencing significant 
mental health problems or complex needs, in addition to their learning 
disability.

The Community Team provides specialist assessment, diagnosis and intervention 
for children and young people with a learning disability, for a range of 
complex problems, where universal services are not able to meet the child or 
young person's needs.

The team works together with children, young people and their families in 
community of settings, in particular, schools and family homes, as appropriate 
to the needs of individual child or young person. The team provides planned 
assessment and intervention outside normal office hours where appropriate.

Our multi-disciplinary team includes a Consultant Psychiatrist, Art 
Psychotherapist, Psychology, Occupational Therapy, Community Nursing staff and 
Primary Mental health Workers. 

Children and Young People with Learning Disabilities can be referred for 
assessment of the following: 

Challenging Behaviour
Depression/Psychosis
Anxiety Disorders/ OCD
Tics/Tourettes
Epilepsy
Autism
ADHD
Sleep Difficulties
Parenting Problems 
Development Delay affecting;     Communication, Eating, Drinking, 
Play,Mobility, gross & fine motor skills, Self-help, Socialisation or other 
life skills.
Toileting (including enuresis & encopresis)
Attachment Disorder
Deliberate Self Harm 

Parents, carers and professionals can refer children and young people to the 
team.

painting, playdough, glueing and singing.  I enjoy working with the children 
and get a lot of pleasure teaching and helping the children learn new 
concepts.  I feel I can offer children patience, understanding, time and 
enthusiasm.

services.tags: Debt & Money Advice;Support Groups & Helplines;Information & Advice;Rights & Legal Issues
services.description: Our Aim at Payplan Is to offer you a realistic prospect of becoming debt-free so that you can look forward to the future without money worries. With a comprehensive range of solutions under one roof we can help you keep your home, clear your unsecured debts and reduce your everyday living costs. All of which helps to ease the considerable stress caused by debt. We help over 100,000 people each year through our helpline dealing with people in every possible financial situation. We understand how difficult it can be for people to ask for help on this very personal subject. But one call to Payplan can be all it takes to get your finances back on trance. Our Debt plans are Free Instead of charging you fees, we are funded by members of the credit industry who recognise the value of our sustainable solutions. To be eligible you will usually have unmanageable unsecured debts. And we can assist you even further........ Mortgage Help Sometimes re-evaluating your mortgage will be sufficient to get you back on track. Our in-house mortgage experts have access to the whole of the market and can find you the most suitable mortgage for your circumstances, quickly and easily. Budgeting Advice As part of Payplan's commitment to helping you become debt free - or simply as a way of improving your finances - we offer a no obligation service which aims to cut what you spend on everyday living costs. This covers home energy, internet, telephone and insurances.

Fairbridge is a national charity that aims to give young people from 
disadvantaged areas a fairer chance to succeed in life.  Every year we win the  
trust and commitment of over 3,700 young people that most other organisations 
find it difficult to engage. Outside education, training and employment, they 
have often lost hope for their future.  We help them to think differently. 
Using a unique a combination of long-term personal support and challenging 
activities, we enable young people to build a sense of self worth and develop 
the personal, social and life skills they need to enjoy a future full of choice 
and opportunity. The Fairbridge U16 and 16+ programmes provide personal 
development for young people aged 13-25 who struggle with personal and social 
skills, lack confidence and motivation, and who may not be engaging effectively 
in statutory provision, such as education, employment or training. The primary 
area of focus for the U16 and 16+ programmes is the development of personal and 
social skills. This provides a solid base for participants to develop relevant 
secondary core skills in employability, education, independent living, and 
recreation and community skills.
services.referralOnlyDetails: For further info/discussion about Fairbridge criteria please contact an outreach worker on 01642 201107

CREST is a confidential service which can offer advice, support, guidance and 
detox. We also aim to support young people who have drug problems with housing, 
employment, education and training as well as offering support to parents and 
carers. CREST is an outreach service providing  appointments at an appropriate 
place to suit the young person.

Hi, my name is June and I have lived and worked in South Bank most of my life.  
I am a mother to two grown up children and a grandmother to three grandsons.  
As I worked all the time while bringing up two children, I know how hard it is 
to find the right childminder.
As an older childminder, I offer a warm, friendly, happy and secure atmosphere 
(just like any Nana would).  I feel I have a great opportunity to help 
encourage and develop children for their future.  To me no reward is greater 
than to see a happy, content, smiling child.

refresher courses,one day, 3 day first aid at work, child, sports, and many 
other contexts plus first aid fun days. Please contact to discuss your 
requirements. Other courses available: Effective Communication for Work and 
Presentation Skills, Equality and Diversity, Disability Awareness, Professional 
Trainers Certificate for Inhouse Trainers (CIEH). Trainer is experienced ex

services.description:
Victoria offers care all year, full and part time, early mornings, before and 
after school, emergency, short term cover, holiday cover.

Pick up/Drop off from Normanby Primary School and Ravensworth Junior School

My name is Vicky Watson.  I live in Normanby with my husband and three 
children, between the ages of 18 and 8.  I have recently qualified as a 
registered childminder, however 18 years of experience has certainly come in 
handy for this line of work!  I live in a four bedroomed detached house with a 
private enclosed garden.  Perfect for little ones to play safely.
MY SKILLS - prior to becoming a childminder I have worked for a number of local 
authorities but decided I wanted to have a more rewarding career.  I love being 
around children of all ages and often marvel at the simple pleasures that can 
spark a child's imagination.  It's wonderful to see them grow and develop 
within your care setting.  Most of my experience comes from being a mother of 
two of my own children (18 and 16) and my stepson (8).
A typical day in my setting may involve visiting the library, dancing and 
singing, reading and listening to stories and even a game of dress up to act 
out what we have just read.  Children of all ages can get involved with and 
enjoy doing crafts.  From finger or sponge painting to play doh modelling, 
looking after their own flowers or veggies in the garden.  Older children may 
like to hep cook a simple and healthy lunch.  Weather permitting we take 
regular trips to local parks and woodlands and have plenty of educational toys 
and games to entertain at home.  I believe in having a routine, but also have 
enough flexibility to be child led.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Childcare Home Practitioner - Apr 12
Paediatric First Aid - Apr 12
Food Hygiene - Apr 12
Safeguarding Children - Mar 12
Safeguarding Children & Internet security - Mar 12
EYFS Update Training - Jul 12
18 Years Parenting Experience
Masters Degree (not childcare)

For more information please contact the Families' Information Service.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: Telephone the Families' Information Service for more information

services.description:
Pick up / Drop off at Lockwood Primary and Skelton Primary

My name is Alex.  I live with my husband and 3 children aged 18, 11 and 4.  We 
have 2 cats Peppa and Hollie.  There is lots of room to play indoors and 
outdoors and a wide range of toys and activities to keep your child 
entertained.  I am a qualified Nursery Nurse and have worked with children aged 
birth to 14 years in the 13 years since I qualified.  I have worked in a 
variety of settings from afterschool clubs to Surestart centres.  For the past 
9 years I have worked for Surestart as a Early Years Practitioner, portage 
worker and most recently, as part of the family support team.
In my care your child/children will be cared for professionally in a safe, 
friendly, home environment with lots of space for a variety of play, 
exploration, fun and quiet times.
I understand that every child is unique and will carefully plan activities 
around individual childrens needs.  I have a broad range of resources which I 
will continue to add to in order to offer children experiences indoors and 
outdoors that are fun and educational.
I offer a variety of home cooked meals and snacks and will work closely with 
you to ensure your child's individual needs are met.

Project work or small scale research

Much of our work is around the area of special educational needs though we have 
a more general role in relation to concerns around the psychological 
development and well being of children and young people.

Our specialist areas include the effects of:
Thinking and learning difficulties;
Communication and interaction difficulties;
Behavioural emotional and social difficulties; Physical and sensory 
difficulties;
Early Years and autistic spectrum conditions; 
The needs of children looked after by the Local Authority.

TVA is an arts development agency based in Middlesbrough in the North East of 
England; it is an organisation which champions participation in high quality 
arts and stimulating creative activities as a tool for improving the quality of 
life and learning for individuals and communities. TVA works in education: 
designing and delivering stimulating programmes for able students, for 
disengaged learners, for excluded or at risk pupils, and to deliver the science 
curriculum in unexpected and enjoyable ways. TVA works in diversity and 
inclusion: using the arts to support and empower people who face life's 
challenges. TVA works to bring people together with mutual respect and 
celebration. TVA has thirty years experience of managing and delivering high 
quality creative projects in and around the North East of England since being 
established in 1982 as Cleveland Arts.

Caroline is married with 2 daughters and 2 friendly dogs.  She is a qualified 
nursery nurse with an NNEB certificate, a Bachelor of Arts in Children and 
Early Childhood and EYP. She has worked as a childminder, nanny and nursery 
nurse.  Caroline has most recently worked for 13 years in a local nursery. She 
aims to offer children access to real experiences with opportunities to mix 
with children of different ages.The children,including babies, will have free 
flow access to the garden, offering sand and water play, a range of age 
appropriate equipment and a vegetable patch.  Children regardless of age will 
have access to baking, messy play and daily walks to the woods, beach or local

Get Moving Redcar & Cleveland is a new project which is all about enabling 
people to get around by foot, bike or public transport for more of their 
everyday journeys. Whether going to school, the shops, to work or visiting 
friends. The project will help people choose healthier, cleaner and cheaper 
journeys. The work is funded by the dept for Transport and Sustrans is working 
in partnership with Redcar & Cleveland Borough Council and the NHS on a range 
of initiatives that support people of all ages and abilities to access ways of 
travelling that benefit both their health and the environment.

services.description:
Anti-Social Behaviour Team investigates reports of disorder (involving young 
people and adults) as well as neighbour nuisance and can implement actions to 
help alleviate such issues.

Actions can include diversion, prevention or enforcement depending on the 
nature of the complaint and available evidence to support the appropriate 
interventions.

The ASB team is part of a multi agency network that can also:

Support victims of anti-social behaviour in their homes or through the court 
process. Offer parenting support and associated interventions. Prepare and 
implement applications for Anti-Social Behaviour Orders. Visit schools and 
youth/community groups to educate young people on the consequences of ASB and 
the effect this behaviour has on the wider community.  Information will also be 
offered to groups in relation to the services offered by the ASB team and how 
to report nuisance behaviour. Co-ordinate and facilitate community based 
diversionary schemes for young people.
services.referralOnlyDetails:
Referrals can be made in a variety of different ways and are received from a range of services, departments and agencies as well as residents themselves.
Complaints of anti social behaviour can be made by calling:
Your individual ASB Officer,
Council Call Centre 01642 774774,
Submitting complaints form to www.redcar-cleveland.gov.uk/Forms.nsf/asb?ReadForm, or
by contacting your local Community Protection Officers on 01642 774774 8.00am - 8.00pm &
9.00am - 4.00pm on Saturdays, at all other times contact 01642 771300,
Contacting Local Ward Councillor - 01642 774774

Located on the outskirts of the village of Danby, The Moors National Park 
Centre is at the very heart of the beautiful North York Moors and is the 
perfect place to start any visit to the National Park. Find out about the 
people, places and wildlife of the North York Moors with the interactive 
exhibits and take a look at the acclaimed Inspired by Gallery, with its 
changing exhibitions of work by accomplished artists. 
 
For kids, theres an outdoor adventure play area, indoor climbing wall, 
childrens trails and a lively events programme. There are pushchair and 
wheelchair friendly woodland and riverside trails around the grounds, and 
plenty of picnic areas and seating if you just want to sit back and soak up the 
fantastic views across the Esk Valley. 
 
There's also an Information Centre for inside info on the North York Moors 
National Park. Remember your visit to this special place with a gift from the 
shop or sit back and enjoy a taste of the Moors with a bite to eat from the 
Woolly Sheep café.
services.contactName: The Moors National Park Centre, Danby

Marie offers individual and group play therapy to children and young people who 
are experiencing emotional difficulties within the Tees Valley area.

Play therapy offers children and young people a safe and confidential space in 
which they can explore their feelings and experiences in order to achieve a 
greater understanding of their own thoughts, behaviour and needs.  By doing 
this creatively through play and art, children are offered a medium of 
expression that matches their individual developmental level and interests.

Marie works closely with the family and school (where appropriate) in order to 
facilitate sustainable change for the child.

services.description:
The Redcar and Cleveland Learning Disability Support Service delivers person centred care and support to enable adults with a primary diagnosis of learning disability to live independently within their own homes.
The team strives to help maintain the person's independence and to preserve and enhance their quality of life. Each person has a support plan which outlines the care and support they need. The people being supported will be empowered to make their own decisions and the team will provide information, assistance and support as required.

People supported by the service are kept informed of and participate in the process of support planning and are enabled to make choices regarding their care.

Every person supported by the service will have a written contract and a support plan, which they have been involved with drawing up which outlines care needs, wishes, preferences and personal goals. The plan is reviewed on a minimum 6 monthly basis. 

Our staff will arrive and depart at a planned time and will work the time allocated in the individual's support plan. If there is to be any change in their care or support worker, they are informed in advance.

A quality assurance system is in place and satisfaction questionnaires are issued on an annual basis.
services.keyFeature1: Provide Person Centred Care as determined by the person's support plan
services.keyFeature2: Registered with CQC and comply with the essential standards for quality and safety
services.keyFeature3: Staff are well trained to a minimum NVQ level 2 or equivalent
services.keyFeature4: Provide support to adults with learning disabilities in their own homes
services.keyFeature5: Support people to remain independent in their own homes
services.keyFeature6: Quality of service delivery is monitored

services.serviceName: Upsall Hall- learning disability day service
services.description:
Upsall Hall Rural Centre  provides social care for adults with a learning disability who wish to make progressive development towards work and volunteering. We will consider anyone who has a primary diagnosis of learning disability where an assessment of need has been undertaken and the person has expressed an interest in gaining new skills or qualifications which could lead to employment or volunteering opportunities. The team of support workers at Upsall Hall provide support through a number of work areas that offer opportunities for learning, training and work experience.

The service delivers care and support to people on an individual basis determined by their assessed needs and an agreed care plan.  People using the service will have their own support plan which details the level of care and support required and also indicates the person's desired goals and outcomes. Levels of care and support are tailored to meet individual needs and aspirations.  

Upsall Hall Rural Centre provides a service between the hours of 9.00am and 4.00pm Monday to Friday.
  
The support co-ordinator and support workers are available between the hours of 8.30am and 4.30pm Monday to Thursday and between 8.30am and 4.00pm on a Friday.
 
The work areas which are available at Upsall Hall are as foillows:

Swan Farm Kitchen- experience of catering work
START @ Art Studio- people can develop their creativity and art skills and set up their own micro enterprise.
Swan Metalcraft- metalwork skills
Swan Garden Furniture- woodwork skills
Upsall garden shop, Greenhouse and Grounds- gardening and horticulture skills
Upsall Farm- animal care
Upsall Cottage Cafe- catering and service skills

services.description: In order to be eligible to vote in elections, eligible citizens of the Borough need to register first. Not everyone who pays Council Tax is entitled to vote, therefore there is a separate list for Electoral Registration. Anyone over the Age of 16 who is British or a qualifying Commonwealth Citizen, a citizen of the Republic of Ireland or other EU member state, can be registered to vote, although they can not vote until they are 18. You do not have to vote, but being registered to vote gives you that choice. There are 2 versions of the Electoral Register and if you do not wish to be included in the version that is available to anyone to buy, then you need to tell us that you wish to 'Opt Out' of this Edited Version. Once you are on the Electoral Register you will be sent pollcards when any elections are taking place. You can choose not to vote if you don't want to. You may also wish to apply to vote by post if this is more convenient to you. you will need to complete an application form and supply your date of birth and signature on the application form. In future elections you will then be sent a postal pack about a week before election day.
services.keyFeature1: Anyone over the age of 16 can register to vote, although you cannot vote until you are 18

services.description:
Engage@thejunction is a project which has been developed to help young people 
with mental ill health and emotional well being issues to feel happier, be more 
able to deal with life's challenges, be more involved with the community and to 
be more positive and confident about the future. With the right help, the right 
support at the right time, often people feel better and more able to cope with 
the challenges life can throw at us. This project is here to support young 
people who are struggling with their emotions and need someone to listen and 
talk to without being judged. If you are unsure whether or not the project is 
for you call in, telephone, text or email us engage@thejunctionredcar.com

services.orgName: Kids Deserve the Best Nanny Agency
services.description:
Honesty is the Best Policy! And that is what you get from us.

Kids Deserve the Best provide advice and support to families across the whole 
of the North East in their search for home based childcare, such as:

Nanny
Parent's Help
Baby-sitting Services
Emergency Childcare
Wedding Day Childcare

Families tell us what they need in terms of their childcare and we find the 
best possible match to suit them.  This can be organised on a part time, full 
time, temporary or long term nature.

We also support childcarers who are looking for Nanny Work, sourcing training 
opportunities and working with and supporting child and family friendly 
companies to make a range of services available to families.

Kids Deserve the Best Nanny Agency is run by Sarah Parkin who has built up a 
good reputation for providing an excellent quality of service, support 
throughout and after care advice. As no two families are the same the support 
is tailor made to each individual family circumstance to ensure the best person 
is found to suit each families needs.  Sarah is a mum of two children herself 
and has a caring approach and understanding of childcare aspects from a 
parent's point of view in addition to a good understanding of things from an 
employees view point too. Having previously worked in a Nanny Agency, Sarah 
wanted to provide continuity of support for families and Nannies to ensure they 
had the best support available to them and nothing is ever too much trouble and 
always willing to help!

Choosing the right care for children is a big decision - Kids Deserve the Best 
Nanny Agency aim to make the process of employing a Nanny as simple and worry 
free as possible.

services.description: Counselling Services to parents and children.

The project is called 'Street Y's' in a nut shell the project is to target 10-19 year olds into preventative activities and deliver workshops around key themes such as money skills, Drug and Alcohol, Teenage Domestic Violence, Hate Crime, Anti-Social Behaviour, Knife Crime and Violent Crime. The service is mobile so can be delivered wherever required.

The Money Skills sessions is based on 16 hours training, young people learn money skills though trained Barclays staff and the Citizens Advice Service. As well as gaining money skills, they build on their knowledge of peer education as after the 16 hours is complete it is up to the young people to educate their peers on the money skills they have learnt.

services.description:
As most people are aware, domestic abuse is normally associated with having only female victims. One little known fact is that up to 18% (1 in 6) of men suffer some form of abuse at the hands of their partners during their lifetime. Another popular misconception, is that domestic abuse consists solely of violence towards a partner, however domestic abuse has many varied facets, which can include: being continually humiliated, criticised, and shouted at by your partner, constant fear of your partner, partner controls everything, the feeling of helplessness in the relationship, ill treatment which you're embarrassed to disclose to your friends/family, the with-holding finances / money, also sexual abuse including using and with-holding sex as a form of punishment.

We are finding that more men are now finding the strength to come forward and ask for support after suffering domestic abuse from either a female or male partner, which is why we are now offering a male support group in the Teesside area.

The male support group will provide counselling, one to one support and group support. The first session starts on Tuesday 4th December 2012.There is no shame in asking for help and support, and no-one should suffer from domestic abuse. Please ring our helpline on 07982 870303 or the SODA Office on 01642 758849 for further details regarding the time and place of the male support group.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: Please ring our helpline on 07982 870303 or the SODA Office on 01642 758849 for further details regarding the time and place of the male support group.

services.serviceName: Redcar & Cleveland Domestic Abuse and Sexual Violence Service
services.description:
Introduction

Our service works throughout the Redcar & Cleveland area offering support and advice relating to domestic and sexual violence.  This can be physical, emotional, sexual, financial or psychological.

Services

Refuge
 The refuge provides safe and secure refuge accommodation to women and children who are fleeing domestic abuse.   Our refuge is purpose built with 12 flats ranging from 1 to 3 bedrooms.  The flats are self contained with a kitchen, lounge, bedrooms and bathroom fully furnished to a high standard.  Within the refuge we also have a training/meeting room, communal kitchen, communal lounge, laundry and children's area.
Whilst living in the refuge customers will be allocated a key worker who can offer assistance with attending meetings, legal support such as attending courts and solicitors, housing, benefits, support with secondary needs such as substance misuse, health, money management, access to counselling and such.

Independent Domestic Violence Advocate (IDVA)
The IDVA can help and support victims of domestic abuse who are accessing or thinking of accessing the criminal justice system.  They can liaise between the police and court services to ensure that the victim's voice is heard.  The IDVA works closely with the witness service which allows court visits giving the victim the opportunity to look around the courtroom prior to any criminal trial and discuss any queries the victim may have.  The IDVA can also offer emotional and practical support to fit in with your needs.  They can help you to explore your options and provide information to enable you to make the best choices for you and your family.

Independent Sexual Abuse Advocate (ISVA)
The ISVA can help and support victims of sexual abuse who are accessing or thinking of accessing the criminal justice system.  The ISVA will liaise with relevant agencies on behalf of the victim and will ensues their requirements as witnesses are provided for if the case goes to court. The ISVA will also arrange pre trial visits to court, explain the judicial process and support the victim and any family members when you give evidence incourt.
The ISVA can offer regular emotional and practical support and help the victim deal with any of the effects from the rape, sexual assault or childhood sexual abuse.

Sanctuary Scheme
At times it can feel that the only solution to domestic abuse is to continually move which can mean moving away from family and other support networks.  The aim of the Sanctuary Scheme is to make it possible for victims and potential victims of domestic violence to remain in their home and feel safe. This entails the provision and installation of security measures to a resident's home which will in turn deter the perpetrator from any repeat incidents and allow the resident to feel safer in their home.  Anyone fitting the criteria can be considered for the scheme regardless of who you rent your home from but we will need permission from the landlord/owner to carry out the work.  We will make arrangements with the Crime Reduction Officer (CRO) to carry out a property survey and risk assessment. 
Temporary refuge accommodation can be arranged through Foundation UK for clients who still feel threatened and are at risk of further violence whilst they are waiting for an assessment and for the agreed measures to be installed.

Children & Young People Service
The overall aim of the service is to provide therapeutic support to children and young people affected by domestic violence.  An integral element of the support will include reducing further risk and safeguarding.  This will be done by providing Assessment of need, individual support, group support, safety planning, advocacy, social and recreational activity and preventative workshops.  We have listened to children and young people and this is what they say they want from our service:
- To have someone who understands to talk to
 - To learn how to stay safe
- To meet other children and young people who have had similar experiences
- To be in control of the support they are offered

Freedom Programme
The Freedom programme is a 12 week rolling programme.  This means you can join at any point, the benefits are the same so long as you complete the whole 12 weeks.
Who is it for: The programme is for women who have experienced domestic abuse in the past and for women who are presently in an abusive relationship.
The aims: 
- To help women understand the beliefs held by perpetrators and in doing so recognise which of those beliefs they have shared
- To illustrate the effects of domestic abuse on children
- To assist women to recognise potential future abusers
- To help women gain self-esteem and the confidence to improve the quality of their lives.
services.keyFeature3: Children & Young People's Service: therapeutic support .

services.serviceName: Specialist Child and Adolescent Mental Health Service (CAMHS)
services.description:
We are an NHS assessment and therapeutic service for referred children and young people (up to their 18th birthday) and their families.

The service offers assessment and/or treatment for children and young people suffering from emotional, behavioural, relationship and developmental difficulties which have a big impact on their lives and require specialist intervention. These difficulties can include developmental problems such as autism, anxiety, low mood, self-harm or family problems. The team consists of nurses, clinical psychologists, nursery nurse, psychiatrist and administrative staff who have undergone further training within the Mental Health field and we have access to specialist teams for eating disorders, pyschosis and 24 hr care.
